26679077.review:
Blazblue: Chrono Phantasm Extend is the third installment in the Blazblue franchise offering new players and veterans a solid fighting game experience with its fast paced gameplay and newly recomposed soundtrack by Daisuke Ishiwatari.

The game is very beginner friendly to those new to 2D fighting games as the tutorial teachs new players the basic fundmentals of a 2D fighting game and provides the player with character specific tutorials, giving a quick rundown of their drive attacks, specials attacks and distortion drives (supers) in addition to character specific strategies of approaching your opponent. 
The Library also provides an extensive amount of knowledge to new comers which cover 2D fighting terms, techniques, and language commonly used amongst the Fighting Game Community.

The cast has expanded introducing newcomers or characters who have made an apperence in the previous installments.
Old characters have been either modified with new tools and techniques to give them an upperhand, as well as introducing new characters with completely unique play styles such as Terumi who uses supers instead of the usual special attacks and the overdrive ability allowing you the option to either use it to enhance your drive attacks (Ragna gains extra damage and absorbs health with each hit) or spend it on a burst to break out of a combo. 
Note that Terumi is considered complete garbage in competitive play, however don't let that stop you from having a blast with him and his taunt combos.

The story is still presented in a visual novel fashion with the occasional fights and options to provide you with a gag reel.

The music has been completely recomposed for better or for worse, giving off a stronger vibe with most songs, however if you miss the original soundtrack from Continuum Shift, they can be purchased with ingame currency in the Gallery for dirt cheap.

The netcode would be considered up there with Killer Instinct which is amazing as well as maintaining an active community, however with Central Fiction's recent release it may decrease by a small amount but you can always ask on the Steam Community forum for someone to match up with if you're having trouble finding a match. 

Controller support has worked like a charm and I've had no real issues with any type as far as I know(this is including a PS3 fightstick, Xbone controller, Dualshock 4, Keyboard, a bagin bin wired D-Input controller.)

All in all, Blazblue:Chrono Phantasm Extend is an amazing fighting game for both those new to fighting games and those familiar with fighters.

TL;DR 
Chrono Phantasm Extend is awesome for new comers and those familiar to 2D fighters.
Beginner friendly tutorials.
Music is awesome.
Characters are fun in their own unique way. 
Controllers work. 
Netplay works. 
Community is alive. 
And Terumi mains suffer eternally until moving onto Central Fiction where they laugh at Kagura mains.

26344654.review:
This is actually a really good game. I'm usually not a fan of traditional fighting games, but this game really got me into them. Obligatory "Fun for novices yet enough depth for pros", it really does deliver on those fronts. (I highly reccommend watching the EVO 2014 Grand Finals between Garireo and Dogura.) 

It has a bunch of Single-player modes, some of which I'm not good enough for yet, but they're all still pretty great. The story mode is a bit of a brick wall at first if you haven't played the other games, but I didn't play them and I still found it to be a great story. Enough so that I'm considering buying the other games just to see what happened before. At some points in the main story, there will be a choice of 2 paths. One of which continues the serious story, the other one leads to a Gag reel, where something goofy happens. One of my favourites is Jin's Ragna Island.

Just a heads up, at least half of the females in this game are sexualized, and so are about third of the men. If you don't like seeing slightly concealed breasts or impressive male chests, you might end up feeling uncomfortable. Despite it, the game has a mild sense of self-awareness, being this far into the series. It's not afraid to make fun of itself, and it also has some great serious moments (Roy ;_;). The story doesn't keep the same mood for the whole time, which drags a lot of other stories down.

The online multiplayer is honestly pretty good too. I noticed almost no lag, which is huge for a fighting game.

I'm happy with this game.

26031031.review:
Пока консольщики проходят японскую BlazBlue Centralfiction и вешают спойлеры на YouTube, а ПК игроки продолжают наигрывать матчи в ChronoPhantasma, я решил написать этот обзор.

Итак [b]BlazBlue Phase III Chronophantasma Extend[/b]. Спустя около полугода после своего выхода на консоли в Европе она перекатила и на ПК. 
ArcSystems, судя по всему, решили сделать эту часть BB как можно лучше, проработав новые режимы и переработав уже присутствующие. Так [b]Training Mode[/b] обзавёлся индивидуальными гайдами для персонажей, [b]Story Mode[/b] лишился индивидуальных сторилайнов но приобрёл в обьёмах общего сюжета, а [b]Abyss Mode[/b] приобрёл почти RPG элемент зачистки поздемелий. [b]Network Mode[/b] стал лучше, но я всё ещё советую тщательно отбирать людей по качеству соединения.
Список новых режимов небольшой, всего 3 штуки:
[list]
[*]Library mode
[*]Remix Heart Gaiden
[*][spoiler] Highlander Assault Mode [/spoiler] открываемый по прохождению Режима Истории.
[/list]
Список играбельных персонажей тоже увеличился. К уже существующим 19 добавили ещё 9. Да Lambda-11 и Nu-13 это по сути один и тот же персонаж, кого это еб*т?

В механическом плане игра тоже претерпела изменения. Был добавлен режим Overdrive (A+B+C+D) и новый способ пробития блока противнику. Сами бои стали быстрее по темпу и чуть дольше по продолжительности ( не в моём случае правда).

Весь этот торт был украшен вишенкой из новых локаций  и переработанных музыкальных тем персонажей.

На итог мы имеем просто качественно сделанный файтинг с хорошей исторей, удобной простой боевой системой и 
 классными персонажами. Что тут ещё можно добавить? 
Лучший стэйдж — Magister's City -ISHANA- 
Лучшая VS тема — Six Heroes.
Nu-13 — спамер.

Всем спасибо, ждём Centralfiction!

25513397.review:
This is by far the best 2D fighter I've played!! 
I've actively been playing this game at least 2 hours a day and I can't stop loving it! 

The various modes provide you not only the possibility to play against a computer ([easy - normal - hard - very hard - nightmare]), but also to play against your friends either local or online!
The fighting mechanics are a lot like Street Fighter, Skullgirls and KOF. So it's definitely not like Tekken!

The story mode is actually something like a visual novel, mixed with random battle scenes you have to fight yourself! The result of the battle is what determines the next dialoges!!
It's also pretty awesome how some characters have special intro and outro scenes due to their lore connection. Their lore connections are really well explained in the Arcade Mode, where you can play each character's individual lore by completing a total of 8 fights, which are devided in 2 to 3 rounds (depending on if you get your 2 consecutive wins immediately or if you've lost once and won two times).

Every character has their unique fighting style and follow-ups in their combo's. You could either pick the INCREDIBLY agile and rushing Yuuki Terumi, or you can go for the super strong, countering Hakumen. Characters that range in between are most likely Izayoi or Ragna The Bloodedge (who also has lifesteal abilities). My point is, again, that each character is unique and amazingly put together!

Anyway, if you're looking for an anime styled fighting game and enjoy playing these kind of games with your friends or just by yourself, look no further!! This is one of the most best games out there!
And don't worry about the price, I'm telling you, it's SOOOOOOO worth it! EVERY LAST BIT! ^^

24778396.review:
TL;DR - If you like fighting games OR Visual Novels (or both) give this a shot, it's worth your time.


Pros:

	- Large and diverse playable cast, no Ryu-clone syndrome here!
	
	- 'Sylish' control mode allows new players to play without being overwhelmed by
	  the controls (1-button special/combo mode) at the cost of losing some options.
	  
	- Great soundtrack backing up the fast-paced action and story modes.
	
	- FULLY voice acted in both English AND Japanese(and the dubs don't completely suck)!
	
	- Staggering amount of depth to the fighting system if you're into that.
	
	- HUGE amount of single player content including:

		- 3 Practice modes
			- Indepth tutorial mode for basic gameplay and indiviual characters.
			- Standard training room mode with some of the best training options I've seen.
			- Combo challenge mode (that actually teaches decent combos!).
			
		- 3 Visual Novel stories (one is a recap of previous games) clocking in at over 30+ hours
			- Main story
			- Side story
			- Recap story with chibi's
			
		- 6 single-player modes
			- Standard arcade mode with some pre-match story dialogue.
			- Standard VS. mode against CPU or second local player.
			- RPG-ish Abyss mode where you fight waves of cpu opponents and level up.
			- Score attack mode where you... go for the high score. Yay?
			- Unlimited Mars Mode... Fight OP boss-versions of the cast and hate life. 
				-(Winning unlocks the boss-version of your character for play!)
			- Hidden mode unlockable after finishing the main story (Final Boss fight).
		
		- Netplay modes (Ranked/Lobby)
			- Ranked mode is standard 1v1, finds you an opponent and you fight.
			- Lobby mode
				- Customizable chibi avatar enters a room and fights in one of 3 modes
					- Standard Match/Spectate where 2 people play and the rest watch
					- FFA mode with up to 4 matches being played at the same time. No spectating.
					- Team battle mode where the room splits into 2 teams and fights it out.
				- There are also replay lobbies and online training room lobbies.
		
		- Replay mode to watch and/or archive matches
		
		- Gallery mode where you spend ingame $$ to unlock:
			- Fan art for viewing
			- Announcer voice sets (after beating arcade mode with a character)
			- Stages/Music from previous games
			- New lobby avatars
			- Unlimited mode characters (once you've beaten unlimited mode with a character)
			- Character colors
			- Pieces of official and fan art for viewing
		
		
	Cons: 
	
		- Does NOT play nicely with fullscreen mode, alt+tabbing will crash the game.
		
		- Changing the resolution from the default causes the sprites to become distorted.
		
		- There's not as many people playing this as there are say, SFV. Online lobbies exist
		  but your friends list and things like the discord BB community will be the best way
		  to find other players.
		  
		- Netcode is mostly solid, but there's a lot of people with bad connections/computers
		  playing that can ruin the experience. Remember to let match intros play out to sync
		  connections.

24748856.review:
Well finally done with this game. After playing it PS3, PSVita and PC I come to the conclusion of how to review this game.

First of all I'm going to mention that I'm not saying it's not recommended for everyone, just people who think this game should be held competitively.Theres a number of things I want to go over in the pros and cons.

  -Pros

-More moves
-Some characters got better for the mechanics
-PC version runs better than the other versions
-Characters are still unique and diverse


 -Cons

-Clearly poor MUs. 
Some misjudged and some are brutally obvious. (example Litchi Vs Azrael. Supposedly in Litchi favor but if Azrael touches you it becomes a endless stream of 50-50, cross ups and nasty Growler to punish any DP or staff recovery attempts. In turn you can't set up for oki well due to Growler and its hard to bait Growler due to his new ability to fireball immediately after eating a projectile.)

-Abusive comeback mechanics
Overdrive is one of these. Only really helpful to some not all characters. As well as "rechargable bursts" allowing players to burst up to 4times a fight which can completely switch momentum. Between these 2 mechanics you will always feel like you were cheated when your outplaying a opponent and you fail to bait their burst, putting you in the corner/on the defensive.

Allowing people to Overdrive on block was the stupidest thing I have ever seen. If Overdrive causing characters to be better than most others, there is no clear reason why players should get more options to get them out of blocking besides learning how to defend themselves and poke/jump out of gaps/throw punish.Some characters even get brutal returns when they use this while low on HP. This can brutally butcher some characters gameplans making "nuetral" more of a "we are jumping and airdashing but noone is getting hit" cliche.

-Lowing the gap between beginners and high level play.
I'm not going to list it but there are characters in this game that are so good at shutting down other characters options that a majority of the MU are in their favor/even and on top of this they are derp easy to play. If your under the assumption that hardwork=good in this game your wrong. If your planning to win your going to be playing the same characters as everyone else. more specifically, you'll never be playing Arakune. ARKsys has been aiming to make high level and low level play the same. It's showing more every update.

Refer to Stylish mode buffs from BBCS-BBCP for details on "beginner mode".

-No diversity.
Jin, Ragna, Tager, Azrael, Terumi, Celica, bullet, Kagura. If you want to see the rest of the cast, play them yourself or pray.

-PC and the community is still laggy
I don't understand.

-Dead characters
Idk if they are plain useless or just that bad tbh, but I know Arakune is dam there unplayable. Afew others I haven't even seen since EX release, like Amane,  Carl, Valk, Relius and afew others. The community is so full of the same generic cast that they might as well remove the extras and fix the poor optimization on the Vita version with the extra space.
----

All in all I find this Blazblue be getting worse. BBCSEX was the best. I approve of the new moves but how they are executed is sloppy and just unfair. Characters being not only easier but also more rewarding than others is rediculas. I tried to like this game for over a year now and it's still bad. I want to put it in con but idk if its me but BBCP also looks worse than BBCS on all systems. They keep adding more and more mechanics but in the end the fight boils down to who can get the momentum.

This game could have been so much better and I understand introducing new characters can mess with balacne. I just hope Blazblue CF is properly tested and balanced because some of these characters are absolutely rediculas. There is no fun in fighting the same small portion of the cast for over a year. I do not recommend this game for competitive play.

Play for fun at most, but not worth more than $15.

24543713.review:
I liked the vanilla version on the Vita, don't have a Playstation 3 or 4, and wanted it for the PC.

It has been a fun game to play, although my PC chugs playing it at times. My PC is old, about 5 yrs old, and that isn't the games fault.

There are several characters to play, story mode, arcade mode, endings for each character, and each character has a different final boss to face.

There's a tutorial mode for general and and ones unique to each character.

There's online, but with my old PC and the fact there are too many great players on Steam, I've avoided playing online.

I think this is one of the best fighting games on Steam, and encorage anyone who loves good fighting games to try it out.

There are some boob jokes, Tao is the worst regarding them, although I enjoyed playing her character, and did better than any other character.

I snagged it for under $20, with a sale and selling some cards. It's worth $20 IMSHO,

24407854.review:
어차피 나 같은 것이 평가하든 안하든 잘 만들어진 수작인 것은 틀림 없다.

킹오브파이터 시리즈가 2d를 벗어나려고 몸부림 치는 가운데서도 독보적(물론 다른  훌륭한2D 격투게임들도 많이 있지만)으로

격투게임들을 전문적으로 그것도 시리즈물로 만들어내면서 고집을 꺾지 않는건 정말 아크시스템웤스사 밖에 없지 않나 싶다.


그런 아크 시스템사를 이끄는 쌍두마차 중 길티기어의 영향을 많이 받고 탄생된 동생 게임이라 할수 있지만 어언 본 세계관의 4부작 중 마지막 작품이

작년(2015.7월 경)에 출시되었을 만큼 나름대로 긴 전통을 가진 게임이다. 


스토리가 상당히 깊고 무거우며, 꽤 세밀한 설정이 가득한 게임이기 때문에 만약 격투게임에 소질이 많이 없더라도 스타크래프트2 이후 시리즈처럼 시나리오만으로도 전체 가격의 반 이상은 굳었다고 생각한다.

거기에 팬심으로 즐길수 있는 컨텐츠들은 물론, 게임머니로 여러가지를 구입해서 게임내 다양한 변경을 가미* 할 수 있는 컨텐츠들도 존재해서 어느정도 몰입해서 욕심내면 20시간 단위정도까지는 최소한 플레이타임을 얻을수 있지 않을까 한다.




하지만 모든 게임에 장점만 있는 것이 아닌 것이... 

키보드로 대전게임을 즐긴다는건 일반적으로 어려운 일이긴 하지만... 

블레이블루 시리즈는 정말 키보드가 쉽지 않은 게임이다.

몇몇 캐릭터는 아에 필살기가 방향키를 360도 파바박 눌러서 ↑↗→↘↓↙←↖↑↗→↘↓↙←↖+ A 입력해야할  정도고..**

심지어 블레이 블루는 격투게임 중에서도 콤보가 아주 복잡하고 어려운 편인걸로 알고있다.

이런것을 키보드로 즐긴다는 것은.. 정말 소질이 있지 않을까 싶다.

따라서 정말 게임을 즐기고 싶다면 호환되는 패드등을 보유한 상태로 하는 것이 중요해보이고...


현재는 잘 모르겠지만, 유저층도 상당히 하드코어한 고수들이 많이 모여있다보니 입문하기엔 정말 힘들다는 이야기도 들었다.
(주관적인 부분인 만큼 새겨들을 부분은 아닙니다)



번외로

한국사람들은 오히려 판매량이 높지 않음에도 불구하고 이상하게 여길 정도로, 아크시스템웤스의 번역에 대한 정성은 놀라울 수준이다. 보통 유통업체가 해당 지역의 언어로 번역을 해주는 편이지만, 본 회사에서 직접 번역 후에 발매하는 것이 특징이다.(영,중국어 포함)

따라서 게임내 번역이 아주 질 좋아서, 오타는 있을 지 언정, 게임에 대한 무지로 오역을 저지르거나 하는 일은 없다고 보면 된다.

그래서 스토리에 완전히 몰입할 수 있게 된다. 중간중간에 등장하는 애니메이션들의 퀄리티도 굉장해서 아주 마음에 든다..




총평 : 
단점 / 격투게임에 아에 소질이 없다면 호오가 분명 갈리는 게임, 거기다 키보드로 즐기기에는 매우 어려운 게임 스타일..괴수화도 상당히 진행되어서 처음 입문한다면 눈물이 앞을 가리는 상황...

장점 /  스토리모드도 굉장히 수준 높고 번역의 질도 아주 좋아서 만약 블레이 블루 그 자체를 즐기기만 하더라도 어느정도 보장할수 있음.
만약 이미 블레이블루의 팬이라면 여전한 라이치 선생님의 교육이나 개그노선 등을 살펴보자면 돈이 아깝지 않은 게임.



총평
블레이 블루를 완전 처음 접하는 사람은 5.5~6.5점 (전작 스토리 모드부터 즐기는 것을 매우 권장함...)
격투게임에 소질이 없을 경우  6.5 ~ 7.0점 (스토리모드나 세계관 경험 뿐이니... )
이전 작을 경험해본 팬, 격투게임을 잘 할줄 알고 새로운 격투게임을 경험을 하러 왔다면 8.0점 혹은 그 이상




ps) 그래서 센트럴픽션은 언제 올려주실 참인가요 모리P님 ㅠㅠ

Пойдём по порядку.
+:
1.Графика и анимация радуют.
2.Герои разнообразны и имеют свои лор как и вся игра.Отведён отдельный пункт на рассказ всей истории и сюжета.
3.Имеется очень очень хороший туториал встроенный в игру.От основ до задродства над комбами героев.Это огромный плюс для людей не игравших в файтинги подобного рода и от этой компании.
4.Даже если пинг из задницы играть можно нормально с небольшими тормозами(сидел с кривого интернета возмодно их и вообще нет))
-:
1.Как и любой файтинг на любителя.Быстро приедается и делать тут особо то нечего.
2.Без джостика лесть смысла нет.Клавиатура ну вообще для извращенцев.
3.И самый огромный минус почему игра получила отрицательный отзыв.Это мультиплеер,то за что формально и покупают игру.Он ужасен.99% играют на теруми(персонаж отправляющий баланс в задницу к разрабам) и весьма вероятно с читами(макросами) дроча тебе одну и ту же комбинацию без ошибок.Если зайдёшь в онлайн ты точно встретишь его.И если не заблочишь удар то считай проиграл ибо ты всрёшь 90% хп в 1 комбо.
4.Ну баланс сам по себе описан выше.Теруми тащит любой бой изредка у меня получается дать в лоб на таокаке(тупо и беспощадно заспамивая ударами и летая по экрану как реально пизданутый кот).Некоторые герои вообще бесполезные или их реализация очень геморойна и не оправдывает средства.Или тыкать 1 кнопку или играть лунную симфонию на джостике,понятно кто победит.

ИМХО онлайн единственная причина купить игру и она никакая.Так что ценник надо пускать на уровень 150 рублей ибо столько и стоит онлайн из 3-6 человек где 5 из них читеры.Даже весь топ 100% имбавозки теруми.Второстепенные персонажи с никаким винрейтом.

24071409.review:
Note: This review is mainly on the single-player content. Not that I eschew multiplayer normally, but the single-player just kept me busy enough!

Blazblue is best seen as a branch of the Guilty Gear series, mainly with the anime and manga influences turned up to - if you'll forgive me - 11. And like anime and manga, this is a vehicle for fanservice. Now, I don't just mean having ridiculously sexualized female characters, though it certainly doesn't lack for those, but in general trying to cater to everybody's tastes in over-the-top characters that are designed so in theory everybody has a favorite to hold up. This is, of course, why the story mode is a endless torrent of visual novel word vomit, so that every one of the 26 characters gets a moment to shine.

I'm getting off track, though, so let's talk about the fighting. It's good. If there's a criticism I'd level with it, it's the usual tendency for fighting games to have feature cruft stack up, from Crush Triggers to Overdrives to Rapid Cancels and actually mastering all of it is literally akin to learning a language. Thankfully, at least at the casual to afficiando levels, mastering every system isn't necessary, but if you go cross-eyed when a game tries to get you to take terms like "Guard Libra", this may be overwhelming. Where the complexity shines is in the characters, though, that each get their own subsystem that really makes them feel unique, with very little cloning in effect. In addition, almost every one of these systems is interesting, and each character contains a lot of depth. Of course, that gets back to my original point about the appeal of Blazblue - shoving characters in your face until you click with at least one. Some require a level of motion mastery that gets downright farcical - Bullet requiring a 1080p motion for one of her super attacks (I'm sorry, Distortion Drives) comes to mind - but most you can manage basic mastery without overt effort if you've played a fighting game seriously in the past twenty years. The end bosses aren't even too much of a headache, which is a rarity. But they aren't fair. Let's not get too hopeful, right?

The story is a mess of anime garbage and word salad (Ars Magus, Hierarchal City, Continuum Shift, etc.), even including an extensive glossary, summaries of the story up until this point, and literal lessons on the game's lore. I do enjoy it as an ongoing anime soap opera, but you ain't getting more than relatively simple characters who will hit their character beats like a dead horse and a lot of melodrama. That being said, it's still fun if unsophisticated, though some of the humor in the gag reels can fall extremely flat, either due to the game's inability to ever let a joke die peacefully, or hinging things on bad sex comedy that feels intensely regressive (panty theft, "wacky" incest, false sexual assault accusations). The nadir is probably the Remix Heart story, which is an extension of the Blazblue manga of the same name which is 95% low-effort ecchi trash... and about 5% positive transgender bit, but it doesn't make up for the former.

That all being said, the game buries you in things to do and unlock, from a survival mode where you level up a character to murderous challenge modes to an extensive gallery mode. It'll take a long time to unlock everything legit, and most of it is cool... but I'm going to throw in a caveat. It's a small, almost inconsequential thing, but the gallery does contain some troublingly sexualized images of the underage characters. If you're in the anime and manga community, you know the drill, and it relates to what I was talking about at first. By trying to appeal to all sorts of people, they also appeal to some people that just aren't worth catering to. It's almost enough to make me give it a thumbs down on its own, and if you've read this far you can give it one yourself based on your willingness to tolerate this sort of baiting.

That being said, the fighting fundamentals are still amazing enough for me to give a recommend, with bright and colorful (if aging somewhat) sprites, and a lot of content for your money. While it relies on quantity over quality to an extent, it has enough unique gameplay notions and clever ideas to give it a recommend with the above caveats. While not as progressive as Guilty Gear Xrd, if you're looking for a solid 2D fighter with a fun cast that can essentially keep you busy for eternity, it's absolutely worth the asking price.

23972071.review:
很小很小的时候我有一个梦想，就是长大以后可以像帅气的大哥哥大姐姐们一样，英姿飒爽地畅玩格斗或射击游戏。但是非常不巧，因为宇宙电波干扰，我成长为了一个手残无药医也的猪队友。大家都不带我玩，我只能擦拭着眼泪一个人蹲在墙角默默抽泣。

然而我并不甘心，开始小心翼翼的尝试一些简单有爱向格斗游戏（例如Skullgirls之类），可惜现实再一次将我无情的撕碎。每次一开游戏就紧张，一紧张就按不出技能，一按不出技能就死，一死就扔键盘，一扔键盘就心疼（啊我的樱桃啊），一心疼就不服气，一不服气就重开，一重开就跪，一跪就扔手柄，一扔手柄就心疼（啊我的X1啊）…… 周而复始，直至将我的精气神全部消耗殆尽。

直到有一天，一个偶然的机会让我知道了《苍翼默示录：刻之幻影》这款华丽的游戏。那绚丽的光影效果，销魂的角色造型，还有劲爆的人物配音令人欲罢不能。最重要的是，某前辈用充满诚意的声音告诉我：『这是一个专为新手设计的格斗游戏噢~』这句话就如一记重锤，击中了我心中最柔软的部分。难以置信这是真的吗？答案是噎死！只要在选人界面按键盘Ctrl键或手柄LB键切换到帅气（STYLE即简单）模式，那么只要连按一个按键，各类乱七八糟宇宙无敌炫酷的大招就会~biu~biu~biu~全部倾泄在敌人头上。（键盘党注意：开始游戏时按TAB键可以切换到默认第二套键位，即WASD方向，UI确认取消，默认的太别扭了。不过还是建议用手柄。）

每当清脆的开场声划过夜空『Rebel One! Action!』，我心中的小宇宙都会燃烧，荷尔蒙瞬间充溢每一个细胞。那指尖跳舞般的流畅操作感，出类拔萃的打击感，另人深深沉浸其中。仿佛所有强大的敌人都瞬间化为了G胖这样的菜鸡，『我叫你打折！我叫你坑预购！我叫你锁区！我叫你改评论规则！』，一边怒斥一边用炫酷的连招打的G胖毫无还手之力跪地求饶。

诚意满满的原生中文支持，友好贴心的新手教学（基本及连招教学、高级技巧还有前作剧情重温）令人敬佩不已。精彩绝伦、跌宕起伏的故事模式和番外剧情，使得每一个角色都给人留下深刻的印象，买番送游戏之名果然名不虚传。加上满足收集癖的全套影片、原声、原画收集系统，无限（Unlimited）角色解锁系统，将华丽程度推向了新的高度。如果你玩过前两作『厄运扳机』和『连续变换』，更可以感觉到制作组之进步，大量新角色，更多的steam特性支持，更多的游戏模式（地牢模式和专为高手设计的无限模式），本体包含全部内容没有坑人DLC，真可谓业界良心。让人对即将发售的最终章『核心剧本』充满了期待。

『我的魔法会把你撕成碎片！接受正义的制裁吧！』我一边嘲讽一边勇敢的冲向那些不给我点赞的敌人们，曾经一座座难以逾越的大山变得不值一提，又一次赢了。我激动的抱住妈妈，『妈妈~妈妈，你知道吗，我终于会玩格斗游戏了！』妈妈温柔地摸着我的头发说：『[spoiler]滚。[/spoiler]』

从此以后天仿佛变蓝了，草仿佛变绿了，就连花儿都对我微笑。望着远方柔和的晨曦，想到自己惊人的蜕变，不禁怔怔流下了激动的泪水，天空仿佛缓缓浮现出『青春』两个大字。我再也不是战斗力只有五的渣渣，再也不是墙角哭泣的受气包，而变成了一个真正的强者，从此走向了人生的巅峰—— 看我的狂暴猫爪（桃儿卡卡），看我的无敌冰剑（琴恩），看我的金箍棒（莉琪），看我的霹雳啪啦哥特青蛙蝙蝠拳（蕾其尔）！我终于可以嚣张地用脚踩在败者的头上，扬眉吐气地喊一句：Loser!

[spoiler]然而这一切都是幻觉，一旦联网分分钟被按在地上摩擦。[/spoiler]

23932007.review:
The next entry in the Blazblue Series.
Pros:
More characters
New overdrive mechanic, allows you to turn the tides of battle
Abyss Mode rework, not a pain in the ass like previous game, stats and upgrades stay between playthroughs
Includes all DLC of Chronophantasma
Soundtrack is just as great as ever, though some remixes are not nearly as good as original
Almost every character still plays differently
They FINALLY made Bang important to the story (fucking barely though), albeit his voice is shit
Waifu here, waifu there, waifus EVERYWHERE
Cons:
Story mode is harder to follow for several reasons, on top of how convoluted it already is
Lore characters are present, so better pull out your Bloodedge Experience mangas
Removal of ability to listen to music and character lines in Gallery Mode
Some new character designs are not as good as older games
The Remix Heart storyline is nothing but fanservice
STILL, Unlimited Mu is the bane of my existence. Seriously. If you fight against a CPU Unlimited Mu (or worse, someone who knows how to play her), prepare to get spammed up the ass. Also on the topic of Mu, Asstral Finish is gone. I want to die.
More fanservice, but nothing out of the ordinary for this series

In short, it's a good game, probably worth waiting out a sale though. If you want story, get one of the other two games (Calamity Trigger is recommended to understand everything)

23848768.review:
This is honestly one of my favourite games. Fast paced, fun, and unlimited styles of battling. The characters are charismatic and developed, with each of them having their own flaws, backstories, character development, and unique play style. The music is very well done, the stages are beautiful, and the gameplay is very enjoyable and doesn't get very old. There's a ton of different options in game, too. The storyline is also well thought out, and is long with all of the characters playing into it nicely. (I used to be a fan of Skullgirls, but after playing this series, it really just can't compare) Though, the one thing I have to say that's bad is that 
A) it may not run great on laptops or lower end computers 
B) The PC version is often released much later than the console version
TL;DR:

Pros:
-Large cast to choose from, each with unique play style
-Well developed and enjoyable characters
-Beautiful stages
-Good music
- Fun gameplay
-Many options in game going from online modes to fun modes that you can play on your own
-Good, long, developed storyline/backstory

Cons:
-May lag on lower end computers or laptops
-PC version usually released a WHILE after the console version
-It can be a little pricey for someone on a low budget (sales are saviours)

23366309.review:
A mí los juegos de lucha me han gustado desde pequeño. Empecé con el Street Fighter 2 Turbo, con el que aprendí las básicas de los juegos de pelea en 2D, y me lo pasaba bien.

Fue pasando el tiempo, y no habían juegos de lucha de mi agrado, excepto alguna que otra excepción. Y se debía a que los consideraba lentos, es decir, combates que los jugabas y te daban la sensación de poco dinamismo. Mi ejemplo perfecto para mí de este tipo es el Street Fighter 4. En él, si derribas al oponente, no puedes seguir atacando hasta que se levante, además de que los ataques son lentos.

Y un buen día, un amigo me enseñó un juego llamado BlazBlue Continum Shift. Me llamó mucho la atención Noel, por usar pistolas que atacan de cerca. Investigando con un primo, obtuvimos el BlazBlue ChronoPhantasma. Lo jugamos y una, y otra, y otra, y otra vez, y seguimos haciéndolo, porque el juego es buenísimo. Combates rápidos, en los que puedes seguir atacando ya sea en aire o tierra, pudiendo crear auténticos combos espectaculares. Combates en los que tienes que saber muy bien defenderte, y saber como atacar si no quieres recibir un Fatal Counter y quedarte expuesto. Animaciones y efectos visuales y sonoros espectaculares. Una historia que es demasiado buena y compleja a su vez.

En definitiva: si te gustan los juegos de lucha rápidos, visualmente espectaculares y con buena banda sonora, con una buena historia, y modos de juego, BlazBlue es tu saga. Y dentro de la saga, este es el mejor hasta ahora. Vale la pena por completo su precio.

tl;wr Nice characters, good punching, some op chars, pretty graphics. Might want to play with friends.

A very nice follow up for Continuum Shift, all characters feel amped up compared to previous titles. 
Pros: 
 - Fast paced combat (Melty Bloodish fast)
 - Lots of widely diferent characters
 - Combat system is deep enough to make grand plays, yet it doesn't take fun away from new players
 - Challenging game modes and difficulties 
 - Top notch 2D animation
 - Story Mode has throwbacks to previous games so you can catch up with more ease
 - Squirrel and Cat girl waifu material
 - Lots of costumization for Online
 - No more unlimited Hazama at the end of Arcade :')

Cons: 
 - Some abused easy-to-use, hard-to-deal-with characters (Looking at you Tager, Terumi)
 - Storyline  is fairly complicated
 - Some moves have ridiculous inputs (Bullet 2nd Drive and Arc, Tager Arc, Kokonoe Pew Pew)
 - As with many fighting games on Steam, Lag.

23139520.review:
So I couldn't give myself the "Dark Flame Master" title but I learned to get over it. Let's talk about the game now.

I watched a friend of mine get reset twice by Hakumen. He got perfected.

I did an 8k curse combo on someone I've never met. He probably had a wife and kids. I cant say I felt regret at my actions.

I left a lobby because the guy didn't pick the lessons background to accomodate my shitty laptop. He had a pink room.

I once saw some guy DP 20 times in a game. He dp'd on wake up, he dp'd in pressure, he dp'd in gaps, he dp'd in air, he dp'd his way through college. His opponent's last thought was "He couldn't possibly dp again right?"

I laughed when a Jin was reset into some Tager's 720. I laughed for quite a while but then I felt immeasurable guilt. Jin sucks but no one deserves this.

A guy I played with sent me a friend request but I turned him down because he was a Noel player.

I once played against an Azrael but I couldn't block some of his mixup due to the lag. I felt the salt bubbling deep within me, threatening to surface; that description sounded almost erotic.

Sigh...

Blazblue is a fast 2d fighting game developed by Mori P. CPEX is the most recent console release version of the game and the PC port is pretty good.

23111169.review:
I'll just be straightforward. Everything about this game is great. History, gameplay, artwork, soundtrack, waifus...
The only sad thing is that its online mode is painfully dead. The matches you'll find will be probably laggy as shit, and you will play against the same person for hours until you find another room.

Don't expect an easy and/or simple game. BlazBlue brings to the table A LOT of things that are different from other fighting games. A majority of the characters will not work well with spamming and mashing buttons, and the comboes in this game are not easy to do, too. Expect a lot of microdashes, different types of command grabs, guards (and ways to break it), playstyles, insane comebacks, etc.
And finally, the better part: Even the weakest characters in this game can be useful and viable. It's very balanced. You can always win, even when playing a counterpicked, weak character.

Worth the money. Play this game.

PS: Can't wait for the Centralfiction port.  Arc System pls.

There are a lot of characters and the combos are still fun and because there are a lot of new combos they are also fresh.  Low tier characters like Tager from CT and CS have their chance to shine in this game as they are A tier now (I hate you Tager >:C).  The balance is overall pretty good.

22998978.review:
Amazing game! I can't believe that I slept on this fighter for years. A game of this caliber should never over shadowed by other fighters such as MKX(not saying that mortal kombat isn't a good fighter but NRS needs to do better!). Ok, I'm not into the whole storyline which is cringe worthy IMO. However, the gameplay is amazing. Imagine MVC2/UMVC3 without the Marvel comics license and the silly assist spamming. Well, there are characters in this game that have assist-like (or puppet master/summoner) abilities but anyways its a 1v1 fighter at its best.

Plenty of different modes including a full visual/audio storyline and arcade mode for casuals and for new people to the series ONE OF THE BEST IN-GAME TUTORIAL MODES THAT I'VE SEEN IN ANY FIGHTING GAME PERIOD! Many companies could learn from Arc System when it comes to the Tutorial mode because it teaches each and everything you need to know about the character you want to play.

Speaking of characters, again BBCPEX has a great amount of variety. You have zoning characters, rush down characters, summoners, all-arounds, grapplers, and even trap based characters. There is literally a character for all styles (Currently play Azreal and the Wolf dude).

What I don't like is the lack of players in the network mode finding a match in ranking is next to impossible at times which again WHY ALL PC FIGHTING GAMES SHOULD HAVE CROSS-PLAY CONSOLE PLAYERS. Granted that the BBCPEX community is very small when compared to the SF and MKX which it make it much more important for Arc System to take heeve to what Capcom and Iron Galaxy did with Cross-play. Sadly, in a few months, the new version of this game will drop on consoles which this version came out 3 years ago. Hopefully, they won't take as long to give us PC people that version with in a timely manner. However, we the PC community dictate that by buying this game!

so, is this game worth buying? Yes it is by a large margin!

22813065.review:
Blazblue Chronophantasma Extend is the third true installment of the Blazblue series. We can see a huge gameplay improvement from Continuum Shift and upgraded soundtrack from the previous two chapters.
What really changed from these two chapters?


+ The gameplay: They added a new mechanic called the "Overdrive" which consist of "powering up" our character for increased damage with the distortions (the super moves) replacing the classic burst. Some characters where buffed or nerfed and got new moves. The newcomers they are cool, I don't see anything wrong about them.
+ The soundtrack: Holy macaroni! They manage to create a even more awesome soundtrack from Calamity Trigger and Continuum Shift!
+ Story: I'm not going to spoil anything but if you didn't play the previous two games or watched the anime (don't do it it's shit) there are two very short recaps of the games. But they don't help much.
+- The story is a Visual Novel. I prefered they animated all scenes instead of using sprites. If you like VNs you won't bother reading the story
- Online is... very poor... Sure there are some people doing lobbies but the ranked scene feels like it's dead. You have to be lucky to find someone at your level and... if you're a newbie... good luck heh
+- The combo system is really fun! But... can be exploited for massive damage combos, which can be annoying if you're playing with a very good player. But doing one of these combos is really hard so you have to practise... A LOT.
- The online needs his netcode to be fixed. If playing with someone with low fps it will be a lag fest
- The balance: Some characters doesn't seems right, sure it wasn't a mess like Chronophantasma 1.0 but it needs to be fixed (probably they won't because they are focusing on the next Blazblue game) I've made a [url=http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=648312550]Tier list[/url] for fun because some characters are too strong for others. I've made that based on the [url=http://www.eventhubs.com/tiers/bb-csx/]Eventhubs leaderboard[/url] and the Gamefaqs forums


And so... Prepare your arcade stick and join the most weeabooish community of 2d fighters!

22749223.review: The 3rd installment of the BlazBlue series!  Whether if you're already a huge fan following since the start or completely new looking to try out a anime based fighting game, this pc port is fantastic for series' veterans and fighting game lovers to pick up right away!  The game literally has tons of content to keep you busy and active for awhile! A huge character roster made of the returning cast and several new additions thanks to the extend version's dlc included.  The modes (not all mentioned here) range from a revamped story (three main plots to follow instead of individual stories now), the classic arcade mode, challenge mode, abyss (survival) mode, and online network mode!  The network mode in general is similar to Continuum Shift's but with noticable improvements to framerates and fluid controls!  Chronophantasma does an excellent job of its tutorial modes initiating players of all skill levels to learn the basics, distortion drives, the new overdrive system, and even goes above and beyond to teach character specific tactics and combos.  Beautiful graphics and new engaging soundtracks (majority are heavily remixed themes from the previous games) add to the action even further!  Overall the latest installment of the series, until Central Fiction releases, is an awesome game that players can explore at their pace and enjoy the fun fast-paced experience of BlazBlue! The wheel of fate keeps turning~

22744990.review:
If you thought that this was just another generic anime fighting game with anime as it's main charm point, then you're wrong.

Blazblue ChronoPhantasma offers a great gameplay and the great story which served as a sequel for Blazblue Continuum Shift, if you never played any blazblue games, the order goes like this
BlazBlue Calamity Trigger ---> BlazBlue Continuum Shift ---> BlazBlue ChronoPhantasma ---> BlazBlue Central Fiction(Arcade(console/pc version TBA)).

The game would be similar to those that you would like to call "easy to learn, but hard to master", low to mid tier combos are doable and easy to learn, but high tier combos require precision and a quite amount of training.
The game offers a wide variety of characters for you to play with, some are hard to use but instantly god-tiers once you mastered them (Carl, Arakune), while some are easier to play and perfect for beginners before deciding to use another character(Ragna, Noel) but saying that easier to use characters are weak in the end game is wrong, each characters have their own depth and the game is actually balanced greatly.

To the visual novel part, to be honest, if you have never played Calamity Trigger and Continuum Shift before, play them first, the visual novel part is actually a big part of the game, not understanding them, or deciding not to dive into the story mode is a huge loss, the story is deep, and sometimes dark, the CGs are well made and beautiful, the voice actors? magnificent(Tomokazu Sugita for example, he dubbed Gintoki from Gintama, and he's a genius at doing retorts), the OST? freaking beautiful, even the OST for the fighting game part induces eargasm as well(Awakening the Chaos and Sword of Doom best eargasm).
You'll spend hours reading texts full of emotion with voice acting in it, but nothing's wrong with it, it's great. and awesome.

To the network side, i have never tested the network mode because i lived in Asia, so i can't really confirm whether the netcode worked greatly or not, but other reviews have said that the netcode worked wonders.

etc stuffs
just buy it, it's a huge plus, especially if you loved arc system works games, not to mention this game is the "Extend" Counterpart, additional characters to use, complete DLCs(with the exception of few voicepacks), story content exclusive to vita, additional story scenarios and gag reels, and they even give you some OST, thanks Gaben.

22604925.review:
Note: This is from my blog, where I included some images and such

Considering this is a fighting game, obviously the first thing to talk about is the controls and responsiveness... and while I've dabbled with fighting games from time to time, there are some universal concepts and commands that comes with these games: up to jump, down to duck, double forward to dash, and various buttons for punches and kicks.. Still I was going into this game blind, having last played the previous BlazBlue title (Continuum Shift Extend) in February of last year, so my skills were rather rusty. Thankfully, my best character was still on the roaster (That being Taokaka) and I managed to blunder my way through several battles in Arcade mode on the games default settings, which is more of a testament to the games controls being very responsive, and with 'practice' one could easily manhandle the game on it's default settings.

So onto how does the game looks... well it looks gorgeous. As a 2D fighter, the amount of detail a game has in the background is plus without it being a distraction. The characters themselves are all rather colorful, if some of the human female characters look rather impractical with attire and proportions. But that's pretty standard with fighting games, and also one of the best things about them. Anyway as you can see, everything is laid out in a traditional format, with the Health Bars at the top and the 'power meters' down at the bottom of the screen.

Onto the sound, and one of the great things about the BlazBlue series is the voice acting is very decent (if at times a bit repetitive, but I'm one to talk), the sound effects are solid with the impact they deliver. Then there is the music, which like a lot of songs for Anime adventure series, have a way of sounding epic and grand while not distracting the player. It blends in perfectly to the background, you know its there, you hear it, but it isn't drawing your attention away from the task at hand, which is playing the game and hoping for a win.

The game has a roster of 28 characters, so there is a lot of replay value for wanting to go through the story and arcade modes to see and unlock everything. Old favorites like Carl Clover, Noel Vermillion,and Bang Shishigami are back, plus new comers like Bullet, Azarel and Amane Nishiki help bring new challenges.

There is a score attack, online play and other secondary features that help keep this game at the forefront of 2D fighters on the PC until the next BlazBlue port comes around in a couple of years for Central Fiction

My recommendation: For $29.99 the price is pretty reasonable, because you are getting the complete game with all the DLC at once shot. So the value is there if you're looking for a 2D-Fighter from a 'franchise' for your PC collection.

PROS:
+Huge variety of characters to play
+VN based story
+Many different types of executable combos and specials
+Excellent sets of tutorials that guides you from the basics of the game in general as well as teaches you roughly how a character is played and ways of executing combos and special attacks (every character have their own set of character-based tutorials)
+Huge amount of character colour templates (begins with a choice of 6 and you can unlock more)
+Profile customization for online play
+Many different types of game modes
+Challenging "Hell" mode AI difficulty as well as a wide range of difficulties available to cater for intermediate all the way to casuals
+Lots of unlockables not even taking into account of Steam Achievements
+Hardly any lag/fps drops(or locks) compared to several other fighting game genre that get PC ported
+Great BGMs that are selectable or automated (unique BGMs that represents the individual character themes and unique themes that are played when certain 2 characters have a face-off against one another)
+Value for money as it doesn't cost that expensive compared to some other fighting games
+Game itself contains many things even without any form of additional DLC
+Choice of Voice Acting selection (ENG/JP)
+Excellent JP Voice Acting
+Iconic series that continues to deliver
+Provides players a choice to play both Chronophantasma or Choronophantasma Extend in Arcade and Online Player Match

CONS:
-In ranked matches, you can see the other player's lvl and name(steam name) and they can just simply decline matches without anyform of punishment. The que can be really annoying if you keep getting match with the same person and he/she keeps declining.

22355299.review:
BlazBlue: Chronophantasma Extend is the "Ultimate Edition" of the 2012 arcade hit, BlazBlue: Chronophantasma and the third entry in the main series of BlazBlue games. It's a fast-paced fighting game which encouraces skill and quick calculating. 

Key Features:
-28 different playable characters most of which brings something different to the table
-4-button based fighting system
-Has an rather long story mode telling an anime-esque story in the style of a visual novel
-Abyss mode allows you to go through gauntlets of enemies gaining upgrades along the way. Highly addictive

Pros:
-Awesome story. Full of carefully written dialogue, big twists and emotional drama. It's also fully voiced in both english and japanese if you're not the reading type.
-Whether you're a casual or a hardcore BlazBlue player there's something for you here. Abyss mode provides a more laid back experience as well as a good place to practice combos, tutorial mode and challenge mode lets low-ranking players become better the story is something everyone should experience no matter their skill level, online mode is of course another good training ground and finally unlimited mars mode which pits you against the most satanically difficult AI you'll ever see.
-Beautiful spritework and backgrounds
-Low initial difficulty curve for a fighting game. As long as you take the time to review the tutorial you should get the hang of things pretty quick
-Great tutorials
-Haven't done much netplay but my experience with it so far has been good. Mostly lagless, respectable opponents and a decent amount of people
-Characters feel rather balanced as far as I can tell.  None really seems overpowered
-Amazing soundtrack
-Contains a side story explaining the events in Calamity Trigger and Continuum Shift so new players aren't left in the dark. I do reccomend playing those if you want the full experience though

Cons:
-The story mode can get a bit carried away with the story sometimes and occasionally forgets it's a game. As such there's a very high cutscene-to-gameplay ratio to the point where it could rival even Metal Gear. Don't look to the story mode for gameplay
-Hard to get into if you're new to fighting games and don't know where to start. If you are new, start with tutorial, practice between each lesson and then move on to challenge mode to learn how to chain combos. There is something called stylish mode if you'd rather play the game casually which basically plays part of the game for you but where's the fun in that?
-Story can get a bit overwhelming at times. They use alot of big words which originate from all over the world and it can get hard to keep track of what's what. If you forget what something is, check out the library which contains a bunch of short articles explaining characters and objects.


TL;DR
BlazBlue Chronophantasma and the whole BlazBlue series as a whole is a bit of a niche franchise. You need to put alot of time into these games to fully understand them. Both in terms of story and gameplay. But once you get into it you will never get out. The captivating world and story keep me coming back to analyze, finding something new every time. 

This game gets a 9/10

22278062.review:
从一代追到了三代，每一代都在平衡上十分重视（但似乎该强的角色还是那么强？？？），第一代连段的时候伤害递减并不明显或者说几乎没有，白面的每一刀都炒鸡痛啊……第二代为了平衡加强了连段的伤害递减（如何科学连段变成了课题），毕竟抓住就把人连到死实在不讲道理……也有了挑战模式，让我这样的手残学到了一些平常不会连段，之后我便爱上了帝卡的摔♂跤。来到了三代，多了好多新角色，三代里最让我满意的剧情，以及每一代都换一次的角色选择立绘。网络对战对新手不友好十分明显，如果没玩过BB系列，要体验网战乐趣就一定要好好学习教学系统里看起来很蠢其实蛮有用的技巧。（比如如何逼迫对手二择，受身时候的方向抉择）如何在对战里施展帅气华丽的连段也是魅力之一。
        ###更新###
        玩了许久，说说后来的感受吧：这个游戏很棒无疑，但是圈子即大众也小众，喜欢剧情通关了就不玩的应该不在少数，每天泡在房间里与别人对战的也有不少，这是这类游戏的俩个极端，比较常见。所以2D格斗游戏的新手混网战太难了，有朋友被虐趴后直接就不玩的也很多，我虽然玩得久，但也是比较菜的，所幸没有放弃，所以除去我这样的抖M，可能这游戏里剩下的都是随时能把你打趴的大触了……因此我想说，新手玩家们慎入啊……既然想玩得开心，就要一定做好被杀翻上百盘的觉悟呀！
         ###更新###
        【全员转战CF，风中残烛CPE】
        现阶段BBCF登录steam应该还在审核阶段，但是也要等一久，所以最近留下来的只有少数大佬，如果打算入坑虽然也可以等到CF出PC版辣，但是鉴于目前网战环境对新手相当友好，玩的人也还有不少，不想被dalao换着姿势吃的萌新们也可以在这个时间段入坑_(:з」∠)_，到时候BBCF出了讲道理也不会太贵

Una joya en 2D.

Sin lugar a dudas que si eres fans de los juegos de lucha vs, estarás de acuerdo en que las recreativas de los noventa tenían "esequeseyo",que molaban en las salas estos juegos, ficha tras ficha, te consumían toda la mesada, solo para demostrarle  a los infaltables espectadores que eras la leche jugando con tu personaje favorito.

Pues BlazBlue: Chronophantasma Extend rescata algo de esa magia perdida, nutriéndose de todo ese universo que en su momento buscábamos es un buen juego de lucha, donde si bien,no habían muchos luchadores de donde elegir,estos  se diferenciaban mucho unos con otros, con mecánicas muy diferentes y por sobre todo,  donde el moler botones nos llevaba únicamente  a la muerte. 

Si te gustan los juegos de lucha y busca una experiencia recreativa, este es el juego que debes comprar.

22253358.review:
由日本Arc System Works公司制作的人气2D对战格斗大作BLAZBLUE系列的最新作《苍翼默示录 刻之幻影》于2016年3月4日正式登陆steam平台。
  
这是BLAZBLUE系列在steam平台上的第三部正作，作为Arc System Works公司的代表游戏之一，发展至今已经有了数部作品，且在漫画、小说等领域中的获得了良好的声誉，作为2D格斗游戏，它已经取得了不小的成就了。而本作从人物造型、场景、招式等方面都进行了不小的修改，可以说是一款彻底的新作品，下面就让诺瓦玲来为大家细细讲解本作。

本作剧情紧接连续变换，拉格纳成功将照美打倒，救出诺爱尔。而幕后黑手帝也出现在大家面前，大战一触即发。故事舞台则从第十三阶层都市迦具土移到了内乱之地斑鸠，处于各种目的联合起来的众人正在为推翻帝的统治而努力，身处阴影中的哈扎马依然带着他那抹不可捉摸的微笑窥视着，他的背后，六英雄叛徒的影子愈发狰狞，宿命的齿轮在这一刻又转动了起来...

画面一如既往的沿用Arc System Works公司擅长的3D+2D混合搭建而成的动态场景，华丽的游戏背景配上出色的游戏系统，带给玩家更多的是视觉享受，感受极致光影下的战斗乐趣。但背景终究只是背景，Arc System Works并没有使用现在绝大多数游戏都会使用的场景互动和场景破坏效果，而追求的仅仅是单一的背景，或许是为了让玩家更注重本身的战斗乐趣吧。

单就“剧情量”而言，刻之幻影表现出了足够的诚意，就诺瓦玲个人而言这次的剧情模式系统改进的简直大快人心，对比连续变换繁多的单人剧情，各种重复战斗，和无脑战斗。本作的线性剧情叙述让人无比的舒服，以及追加搞笑故事，前情概要，小说故事，剧情量和剧情花费时间甚至赶超市面上许多GALGAME游戏，怪不得有人说BLAZBLUE是自带格斗系统的文字冒险游戏呢（笑）

游戏性上，本作增加了数个风格迥异的参战角色，使原本的战斗更加多样化，同样新的角色在台词上也会和老角色进行互动增加游戏的可发掘性，游戏中除了提供单一的“对战模式”，“街机模式”以及衍生的“联网模式”外，还增加了诸如给老手专用的UNLIMITED MARS模式，同样ABYSS模式（爬塔模式）的系统大幅度革新以及点数的奖励也为收集党解锁画廊奖励提供了更多的便捷。

联网对战，算是本作大概也是整个BLAZBLUE系列一个相对悲哀的地方，仅管这是一个口碑非常好的游戏，仅管它的粉丝也不少，但线上匹配的人数真的非常非常少，就诺瓦玲而言，白天基本匹配不到人，晚上做初级成就的时候，来来回回给人调教（大误）数十次，也就那几个ID。线上匹配不到玩家，和一匹配就匹配到老手被虐的一边倒的现象，让很多新人对线上模式望而怯步。

但这在这里不得不说不提一下Arc System Works公司的良心，虽然从表面上大部分日厂开始重视中国游戏市场，但大多数移植上PC的游戏诸如即将发售的弹丸论破2等等，反正知道你们肯定会买账，那我就不出中文。而BLAZBLUE正作自带中文无疑的让人感动，加上联网对战的服务器（诺瓦玲家小水管也可以在不是很卡的情况下跟国外的玩家对战）。以及为了照顾格斗新手推出的一键即可打出“帅气连招”的新人格斗系统，无比说明了这家公司的诚意满满。

优点：
1.优秀的剧情
2.优秀的画面
3.可玩性强
4.游戏系统对新人非常友好
5.打击感优秀
6.BGM大赞（本作无损音乐购买游戏即可免费获得，对某些把音乐当DLC卖的厂商斜眼Ing~）

缺点：
1.角色能力略显不平衡
2.线上模式玩家数量稀少
3.旗鼓相当的对手基本少见，大部分都是老手痛揍新手
4.卡太贵了（喂喂这不算理由吧）

在格斗游戏热潮渐渐消亡的今天，《苍翼默示录 刻之幻影》是一款不可多得的优秀作品，虽然有一些不可忽视的诟病，但其优秀的视听表现却能给玩家带来如同动画一般的战斗体验，其游戏剧情与游戏角色也富有魅力能够让爱好者们细细品味，加上不多见的良心厂商，因此我向大家推荐这部作品。

22201199.review:
我真是放了血，给好评的都是什么心态啊？
我们就拿GGX来比较，这两款游戏相似到了极点，但是我只推荐在STEAM上面买GGX。因为他们在PC上的表现可以说是天差地别。
  首先，说说画面，我刚进BB的时候简直惊呆了你知道么，这画面跟从我PSV上扣下来似的，你是任天堂么你，放到PC显示器上满屏幕的锯齿。看一会我就头晕了。反之，我不知道是什么原因，GGX在我眼中画面是明显的经过了优化，稍微调下设置画面看上去就赏心悦目，而且他们不像街霸5，我的小破本子跑GGX也能随便60帧。
  重点是，他们对于控制器的支持，BB真的就像从PSV上扣下来一样，而GGX不管怎样反正是比BB良心多了。
我有罗技G710+，原装360手柄和拳霸Q4二合一的2015版。我先列出来。方便大家对着入座。
GGX支持以上全部控制器，随意改建毫无冲突和延迟。
BB么，呵呵，改建只能用键盘！！！！！！！！只能用键盘我们强调一下！！！！！！！！
连360手柄都不能改，按下想要修改的案件就给你卡在那，倒不是不能用，ABCD在摇杆上对应上排四个，顺序还是CABD。
我靠这手感爆炸了好么？
总之，尼玛明明都是同一个公司近年的新作，两座也是十分的类似。出在PC的质量竟然能差这么多我也是像吃了屎一样难受。
那搞这出是闹哪样？这是工作组卜给力还是公司重视程度不同我不知道，但是身为一个BB党我的内心十分的悲痛欲绝你造么？
除了BB的第一作之后的每部我都有入手。就差买个PSV版的再买个PS4的了（PS4的摇杆目前还没钱搞）。
结果看见PC上竟然出了刻之幻影的最新版半秒都没犹豫就把手剁了。
你这质量对得起谁啊？至于差这么多么？
总之，如果你想玩，我推荐你去买GGX，体验绝对比目前的这个BB好多了。

22069548.review:
You know who's basically the leading company on fighting games? Arc System Works, with the Blazblue series and the Guilty Gear series, they own two of the few great fighting games there are.

Love Combos? Love action packed games? Love getting your ass kicked by people online? This is the game for you.

Not much of a fighting guy, but enjoy it casually? Don't worry, the more deeper we go into the Blazblue series the more it becomes a Visual Novel. The game has such a great story, with plot twists here and there. Even though it's the third game in the story, it managed to fill you in if you've missed out on the previous games.

Pros?:

- Action Packed Story.

- Fun fighting casually and competitive

- Has a great netcode if you ever manage to find someone online

- Celica A. Mercury, probably the best character ever to be added into a franchise.

- No pay for DLC, it's all in the game, Kokonoe as well!

- Kokonoe has probably been the character everyone wanted implemented into the game, and here she is!

Cons?:

- Even if it has a great netcode, it still sort of feels unplayable when playing online with someone distant, say continents apart.

- If you were an avid player of the originals, movesets were changed, rather, added on, and that definitely makes it a bit harder to relearn all the mechanics

- Not being able to play with console players, this sucks because the online community here is almost never on.

TL;DR:

- The game's great, and if you enjoy fighting games, but don't want it to really interrupt the story it has that, and then there's a whole bunch of fighting modes for you to play.

- Kokonoe Mercury and Celica A. Mercury

- Tsubaki's costume color changed, but that's alright.

- Noel got a new costume and it looks nice.

22041700.review:
ALORS.
Ayant joué à Continuum Shift Extend, que j'avais adoré de part son gameplay (qui est en règle générale, l'atout des jeux de baston...) je me suis retrouvé au paradis avec Chronophantasma.

On se retrouve donc avec beaucoup plus de personnages aux gameplays toujours aussi variés, et quelques changements, comme les bursts qui sont certe, toujours limités, mais beaucoup moins que dans CSE, puisqu'ils ne sont plus au prix de l'ultra, (de l'epicness, que diable !) mais d'un mode "overdrive" rendant plus puissant votre personnage pendant une courte durée, ce qui peux facilement contre balancer un combat (Le punch Lv3 avec makoto en un centieme de seconde, ça fait plaiz')

on note aussi que les especes de machins sur les cotés de la barre de barriere dont j'ai jamais compris l'utilité ont disparus.

Les animations et les sprites sont toujours aussi beaux et soignés (d'ailleurs Ragna n'a pas la meme couleur d'oeil si il regarde a gauche ou droite, ce qui était pas dans CSE).Et la modification de personnages déjà présents dans l'ancien jeu, fais toujours plaisir aussi. (quoique Tager est toujours aussi pété.)

Les artworks sont ENCORE sublimes, la possibilité d'acheter les stages/musiques des anciens jeux est tip-top, presque tout les personnages peuvent avoir leurs voix en commentateurs, on peut acheter du mobilier pour les ROOMS MULTIJOUEURS OUI OUI !!

Y'a également une librairie (et la je met ++ dans mon coeur) ou TOUT le dialecte jeu-vidéloludique des jeux de baston est écrit, et la, poutaing, fallais le faire !

Le seul bemol, c'est qu'une fois de plus, certaines cartes graphiques Nvidia (dont la mienne) ne supportent pas les cinématiques, ce qui les fais planter.

Bref un excellent jeu, meilleur que son prédécesseur, qui était déjà haut dans mon estime.
C'est un "OUI OUI YES"

22006299.review:
Disclaimer: Even thoug my playime may be on the short side, I played this game on PS4
and simply bought it again to support the series.

The definitve Chronpantasma experience, featuring all the DLC released for consoles in one package.

Out of the many figting games on PC, Blazblue is one of te most accessible games out there. It features extensive tutorials on overall gameplay mechanics, followed by character specific tutorials and tactical tips. The challenge mode also offers insight into practical combos for each character to use. The game also features stylish mode, where even the most casual players can enoy seing incredible combos and effects.

Graphically, the game has gorgeous character sprites mixed with full 3D backgrounds. Due to the game being anime style, the art aesthetic will be either hit or miss: if you greatly dislike anime art style, this could be a deal breaker.

Blazblue series is characterized by a varied cast, each character having a unique gameplay mechanic. While some characters are weaker than others, there as an alright sense of balance. Due to characters having different gameplay mechanics, Blazblue is much harder to balance than Mortal Kombat X for example. While these differences may go unnoticed by new players, on competative level, you can clearly see certaiin characters being superior to others.

Some of the characters will be hit-or-miss due to their designs, more so than in other games.

A lot of people complain that the story is generally reading through walls of text, which is true since tis is a visual novel. Honestly though, most fighting games dont even bother having a story. If you are sceptical about te story, ust give it a chance, as the good story telling is what set original Blazblue:Calamity Trigger game apart from the many 2D fighting games. But at te end of the day, if you still dislike it, you can simply use the skip function and breeze through it,

The online experience on the PC port was disappointing to say te least. Latency issues, frequent disconnects and random frame rate drops are all present here. Whike you can find fixes for some of te issues here on the forums, its disappointing that the publisher didn't adress those issues. In my opinion, this is the main deal breaker, as you want to play online wit oter people after you have played through the various single-player game modes.

TL;DR: A solid fighting game, suitable for newcomers to figting games and veterans alike. Unique characters each with their own gameplay mechanics, rendered in glorious sprites. A robust storymode suffering from wall-of-text syndrome, and a grat offering of other singlepayer modes. The main issue with the port is the spotty online functionality.

21954871.review:
BlazBlue: Chronophantasm Extend, while technically being the 6th release total, is the definitive version of the series' third main title: Chronophantasma. The story mode with its branching story paths was good in terms of narrative, though I feel it suffers from "wall of text" syndrome a bit. This might sound ironic what with the story mode of these being in a visual novel style with the fighting gameplay in between, this story has a lot more of the former and not as much of the latter...except for one part where there's a ton in quick succession. Also I kind of miss having individual character stories, but ah well. Extend added a couple additional story paths based before Chronophantasma, CT/CS recaps, and an entire section dedicated to additional gag reels, what more could you ask for?

Other than a personal nit-pick in terms of text:fight ratio, the game brings about what Chronophantasma offered (my two favourite character additions being Bullet and Terumi), along with Celica and the return of Lambda-11, so there's even more waifu to choose from! Jokes aside the combat in this entry is faster paced than previously, and I love it for it. The remixed tracks from older entries are more intense and also more guitar heavy mostly, bringing it closer to Guilty Gear levels, but not Metal enough to be there yet. 

9/10 would Inferno Divider again. Now to wait multiple years for Central Fiction to hit the EU!

21950284.review:
Что можно сказать, новая часть ББ, игра становится сложнее (тут например по сравнению с СР1.0 и СР1.1 буфер для воода ударов порезали в 2 раза). Файтинг шикарный (сам наиграл очень много еще на консоли, задолго до релиза в стиме), но на любителя. Онлайн хороший, коннект радует, люди есть. Для новичка освоится будет сложно (особенно если первый файтинг) и первые десятки часов в онлайне/тренинге пройдут в попытках понять эту игру (особенно если вы до этого играли только в СФ, МК, инджастис, ск5 или любой 3д файтинг), любителям арко файтингов (особенно ГГ) освоится будет гораздо проще. 
Баланс игры на уровне, да есть явные лоу-тиры, но при этом есть очень много персонажей на которых можно очень неплохих результатов добиться, а самые сильные персонажи еще и самые сложные (за некоторыми исключениям). Поэтому выбор персонажей просто огромен.
Нужен зонер? Ню13 или лямбда11
Адский рашдаун с убийственными миксапами вблизи? таокака/ноель/джин
Хочется кого то по-сложнее? Карл или лайчи к вашим услугам
Граплер? Тагер ждет (кстати, редкий случай, когда в арко-файтинге граплер в верхней половине тир-листа)
Все персонажи по-своему уникальны и по вкусу можно себе своего.
Однако не надо расчитывать, что вы зайдете в онлайн и начнете убивать всех, если знаете только 1 комбо и все (это не Мортал комбат), вам быстро покажут, что вы ошибаетесь.
Единственный недостаток - это то что в онлайне практически нету игроков среднего уровня. Есть много начинающих игроков, которые только узнают эту замечательную игру, и есть некоторое количество игроков, которые перешли с консолей и сейчас убивают весь пк онлайн просто за счет опыта и хорошо поставленных персонажей. Но это незначительный недостаток, актуальный для всех портированных файтингов и икоторый невелируется со временем.
А так игре поставлю 10/10. 
Лучший файтинг современности.
После МКХ (нет).

21914418.review:
I played 24 hours of this game. If that doesn't tell you anything about how good the game is, then maybe a more in-depth look into the game will help. On to the review:

Gameplay: The gameplay is solid. It rewards the player for going on the offensive more than when playing defensively because that is the only way you will be able to do extremely good and cool combos. The controls are tight as well. And if you are new to the series (or new to fighting game for that matter), there is a stylish mode you can put the controls in so that it is easier to do combos.

Sound: Holy hell! Some of the best music I have heard in a game. The only one I don't exactly like is the Black Onslaught II. The only reason I don't like it is because the lyrics are terrible. Other than that best soundtrack.

Story: Convuleted as all hell, which makes it the best thing ever. Like you will probably be confused for like the longest time. But when it finally clicks. you are going to be like "WHHHAAAAAATTT! This is awesome!" But that is probably not going to happen because the story literally is the embodiment of chaos, just like the Sonic Fanbase.

Overall, the game is amazing and it is well worth the $30, unlike Street Fighter V which isn't even worth $10. The only draw back I have to Blazblue is that when I go online, I want to use technical, but the other personal can use the stylish controls. This is very minor since it ends up being a closer match anyway, but it is still a problem.

21913760.review:
Performance:
This game is a better optimized than Continuum Shift Extend. In CSE, while I had perfect FPS in a match, the Menus and Character Select were really slow for some reason, 30-40 FPS at times. Also, Astral Finishes would constantly send the game down to 30 FPS. Chronophantasma only dips when loading a match for only 1/4 of a second. This is from playing on a laptop with integrated graphics. Well done Arc on that.

Sound:
As expected of an Arc figther, the soundtrack is amazing. Some of the remix tracks are a little hit and miss, but over all great quality music. Sadly, sound test is completely absent. The bonus Soundtrack is also a little underwhelming. It only brings tracks unique to Extend content for the most part. 

Story:
Quite extensive this go around. Not only do you have the main story and gag reels but you also get abriged versions of the previous games, a short but enjoyable Remix Heart, a Library section to look up anything pertaining to the setting and characters, new gag reels, and more.

Characters:
As to be expected, the new additions are just as interesting as the returning cast. Each designed around unique gameplay styles.

Modes:
A large selection of modes to spend your time in. The training modes are quite extensive with a good tutorial, combo challenge modes, as well as training mode. Other modes include: Arcade, Score Attack, Unlimited Mars (still as insane as ever), a redesigned Abyss mode, and Highlander if you complete the main story. One quick note on Abyss mode, this time around, you will not lose your hard earned currency if you don't make it through the entire run. While I did like the risk in the previous Abyss mode of CSE, I am fine with this change.

Online: 
The netcode works pretty good for most of my experiences. Most of my matches have performed flawlessly with hardly/no delay. Your milage may vary. As for waiting to find matches, it has range for me from approx 5 minute wait to as short as a few seconds of entering into ranked pool.

Extras:
You can now save Local Replays from VS Mode!!! The gallery mode is mostly the same as CSE, but there is a whole lot more to unlock this go around. However, once again, the complete lack of Sound Test can really hurt for many people (myself included).

Overall, this is a solid port thats very fairly priced (especially if you already have previous games for the discount).

BBCPEX 就算不打折买 也是十分划算的. 100不到的价格买一个GAL+FTG ，且两方面做的都很好的游戏（斜眼看街霸V...

从BBCT第一作就开始接触BB，本着“这是一款类似GG的格斗游戏”的心态入坑，直至后来被它的故事模式部分深深吸引.
故事刚开始入坑的人玩起来，应该是一头雾水，故事的时间线非常混乱，专业词条也非常多，每个人的势力关系、个人目的、角色命运等描绘的都各有不同.为了更深入了解剧情，浏览了各方面资料，也看了不少其他玩家对剧情的研究讨论。相信我，等你对剧情稍微理清了一点思路之后，你会十分崇拜BB的编剧的...因为剧情实在太丰富，世界观塑造的也十分成功.期待BBCF RG完结篇的后续剧情.

格斗部分，不用多说，首先这是新手教学最详细的一款格斗游戏了吧...因未他的系统挺复杂，需要新人了解的设定很多，这方面做的很贴心，如果实在只为了体验剧情模式的非格斗玩家，也设置了“帅气模式”操作，简单按几下就能连出一套漂亮的连续技的操作模式.另外游戏里每个角色都是一套系统，每个角色的D键攻击极具个性.网络方面，相对以前通过PSN联网，STEAM的网络要好很多，对战很少卡（相对PSN）目前还是菜鸡一只...只能打打简单电脑，联网就被虐...不过习惯就好...高手开始都是被虐几千次虐出来的...

21857134.review:
Finally! It came to steam!  BlazBlue: Cronophantasma Extend is, of course the sequel to the game BlazBlue: Continum Shift. Just the  "Extend" version from the original Cronophantasma that released only for PS3, adding the dlc character for free and tweaking characters. To start, this is a very stable port. Online netcode seems to be improved over CS's net code, the annoying memory leak that plauged CS is gone as well. How ever the game lack resolution selections,sorry guys no 1080p here, but suprisingly it works to the games advantage, as upscaling would require a redrawing of all game sprites, as everything is hand drawn, well at least the characters are not the backgrounds. The story is, back and longer than ever, however don;t expect to be doing much fghting in the story, its a visual novel in the story mode with very little fights, also be warned, the story is complex, not kingdom hearts complex but complex none the less, I highly reccomend you play the stories of the iother blazblue games. Online mode is here too, suprisingly they did away with the old room system and brought in a new "literal" room that you can decorate, using "money" you earn in game through all game modes, except training that is, it's a neat idea, but you are unable to see your connection with anyone who joins, like you could in other BlazBlue games. The music is the best it's been in the entire series, and fits right in with the old themes of the characters! The art is fantastic as well, and gameplay is smooth and more polished this time around. Character balance is the best it's been in the series, however on that note online fights in ranked are scarce, sadly this is not a popular game, so the player base is very low, so spread the word!

21807011.review:
Well what have we here? ASW finally anwsered our prays and was it worth it? defineldy. I'd say it goes far beyond that actually.

Now let me start this by saying: i am NOT an anime fan, in fact i dislike majority of it, its just not my thing ok? However both Blazblue and Guilty gear are those special roses for me and i do indeed mean this when i say i personally think Blazblue is the greatest anime of all time, i'm sure everyone disagrees and feel free to, it's just an opinion of mine.
With that said lets start with the gameplay shall we?

Now if youre a veteran of fighting games in general your first thoughts might be that its a standard 2D fighter and...youre kinda right. Blazblue is your classic 2D 1v1 fighting game polished to its core BUT it has the Drive button wich is unique to every character and ill avoid major detail but i'll say it really seperates each character from one another, but it makes it harder to master more than one character. all and all the core gameplay of blazblue is perfectly polished with added new ideas that thankfully work

Despite being a fighter blazblues actual main selling point indeed is the story and i'll say this right now: I absolutely LOVE the characters and story, you might think most of them are just stereotypes but play the game and have these "stereotypes" get tossed all around and made fun of. Blazblue has some of the most memorable characters i've ever seen. My personal favourites being Ragna, Makoto and of course Hazama/Terumi in all his glory. now I would go deeper into the story but its best to be experienced by yourself and i don't want to spoil anything, just a heads-up: this story and lore while large and amazing can be really confusing to newcomers and even more experienced players at times. my only nitpick with the story is that i can't stand seeing the imperator more times than my brain can handle, i'm sorry but shes one of the worst villain excuses i've ever seen ESPECIALLY when we already got Hazama/Terumi whos one of the most brilliant villains i've seen in a long time and is so good of a troll he puts hades crying in a corner, but that's just me. 

I suppose the only thing i really need to talk about anymore is the online mode.
uh...i suppose it's good, honestly it works just fine and has plenty of things to do, however what kills it is that theres not many players playing. It's not really the games fault now is it? You can still find people playing it and most of the time they are nice people, but you'll have to search for a while.

Well then time to score this game, before i get into this i'll make it clear: this game wont appeal for everyone. if youre not a fan of fighters, anime and long stories, you propably wont enjoy Chronophantasma, but who knows? You might be suprised, i'm not a big fighting game fan, i dislike anime, yet here I am giving Blazblue Chronophantasma Extend a
9.5/10
Yes, this game is really that good. I could go on and on about the characters, lore, one of the greatest soundtracks in a video game and so on and i highly recommend you give it a try, however blazblue is sadly extremely underrated, it's alongside Dissidia Duodecim as a fantastic game but it's completely in the shadows of games like street fighter and super smash bros, despite it being several leauges better. 

I guess that's all I have to say, have a good day.

21769074.review:
UPDATED ON 18 MARCH

Well well well... Look what we have here: Another installment of one of my most favorite franchises on steam! Hey ArcSys/H2, thank you for this.
Okay, let's see how good this one is. WARNING: This is going to be long! Also, BOSS FIGHT SPOILERS!

Before we begin, I just want to say this game REALLY reminded me of Guilty Gear Xrd -SIGN- at first; because of Guilty Gear characters' icons for your profile, nearly similar design for library section, Izayoi's dash move which is incredibly similar to I-No's dash from GGXRD and the overdrive mechanic which activates by pressing all 4 attack buttons together (sounds familiar, huh?).

First things first, unlike some other fighting games that sacrifice offline modes (you know which ones I mean), this game has a lot of single player content. Story mode consists of the main story and continues from where Continuum Shift was ended; along with extend verion's story, anthology which explains the story of previous titles in a not expectable way, another ((Teach Me Miss Litchi!)) and a storyline named Remix Heart which I tried it recently and has a very... um... weird story. You'll understand what I mean when you play it. Then there is arcade mode, versus, abyss mode (some kind of survival mode), unlimited mars mode and score attack mode. So, if you want to play this offline because of reasons (like myself), you're going to be entertained for a long time.

And now, the gameplay! well... the gameplay has changed a bit compared to the last game. First, some of the mechanics are changed. For example, Ragna's Blood Kain move is removed and it's effects are replaced with his overdrive (Blood Kain IDEA). The second is the overdrive that I mentioned before. Overdrive can enhance and increase the damage of your attacks but it only lasts for a limited time and it's gauge needs to be recharged after use. Also, during overdrive, time counter will freeze so it can be used to your advantage. And one more thing, if you use burst, you cannot use overdrive and vice versa; Because the gauge for both of them are the same.

And now we get to other aspects (I usually don't care about graphics; I just see if gameplay can hook me in). Thank god because this game doesn't have the level up thing which was in the last game. Sure, it was nice at first but it got very frustrating after some time. Also, I have to mention this game has a very nice and polished port and there's a high chance you can get it to run even on older PCs. Now about the final boss (Takemizukachi if I'm not mistaken). This REALLY reminded me of Guilty Gear Isuka somehow (I really don't know why); and it was brilliantly BAD! Why? It changed positions 5 TIMES IN A ROW so I was constantly running from side to side! How I'm supposed to enjoy fighting it this way?

PROS:
- Optimized for PC. You can play this game without problems
- Great story mode (Like always)
- Great offline/single player content
- Fast and challenging gameplay
- Very nice tutorial mode
- Music remixes are mostly done well
- GREAT English voice acting

CONS:
- Final boss.
- Some of the musics are not very good and you probably finish the match before hearing their best parts (This happened for me against Iron Tager).
- There's a glitch in the game that makes it to display incorrectly and out of bounds. This only happens if you close the steam client's window shortly before game launches and is temporary.
- IS THERE ANY POSSIBLE WAY TO BEAT UNLIMITED MARS MODE?!
- Other problems that I wasn't able to spot yet...

VERDICT:
You like fighting games? You like great story modes? You want a learn fast, difficult to master gameplay? You want enough single player content?
If your answer is YES, then buy this game and you will not be disappointed!

Now if you excuse me, I'm going to play it some more... Oh, and I maybe update this later...

21755159.review:
I love me some Guilty Gear, but I haven't had a current generation console since the PS2, so I've been wanting to play BlazBlue for quite some time, and now that I finally have, I can say it took some getting used to.  Combos are easier in this game than they are in Guilty Gear, so that's a plus.  But to help reduce the execution barrier for newcomers, BlazBlue introduced stylish mode, which I still don't fully understand yet as I'm a technical player and prefer to use technical mode for that reason, but one of my friends who's very new to fighting games, is able to fight me on pretty even footing with stylish mode.  Given, I'm still pretty new to this game and still have a lot of growing to do in my skill level, but it's the first time I've seen him not suck, and actually have fun playing a fighting game, so I guess that makes BlazBlue the most approachable fighting game I've seen yet (give or take Evil Zone on the PlayStation or Super Smash Bros.).

The graphics are nice, and the 2D sprites are good, but I feel like they need a little more anti-aliasing to smooth out the outlines a bit.  Still, it's a great looking game and it actually has a lot of special VS intros between the characters, like many older fighting games had, most notably Capcom VS SNK 2.  I missed seeing those and I'm really glad BlazBlue's keeping that tradition alive instead of just using the same intro animations over and over regardless of whether or not your characters have a direct story-line beef with each other.  The game's mechanics are solid, yet smooth as well, and there's a huge variety in play styles among the massive cast of characters.  If you like anime fighting games or Arcsys fighting games, you're not going to want to miss this one.

Pros:
Great graphics, 3D backgrounds, 2D sprites.
Character specific VS intros.
Lots of dialogue.
Story mode's awesome.
Game is awesome.
Beginner friendly.

Cons:
A newer installment's already out in Japanese arcades, but at least we're not three or four games behind anymore.
