21723756.review:
Blazblue CPE, corresponde a la tercera parte de la historia de su universo. Y esta es a su vez la última revisión al balanceo de personajes hecha hasta la fecha, ya veremos que cambios traerá Central Fiction, pero bueno.

El juego contrario a lo que muchos pensarían no es un port, ya que esta vez adaptaron el juego de tal forma que se sintiera como un juego para PC, a diferencia de los dos anteriores, Blazblue Calamity Trigger y Continuum Shift Extend, los cuales fueron pésimos. CT Tenía bloqueado los FPS en 30 y CSE se sentía muy inestable. Por fortuna, Chrono Phantasma llegó pulido y de momento en lo personal no he tenido algún bug que me arruine la experiencia y es muy estable en cuanto a graficos se refiere.
Lo interesante de esta franquicia para los conocedores de juegos de peleas es que cada personaje tiene una mecanica distinta al resto y no hay personajes que se sientan parecidos, es decir, no existe un Ryu/Ken. Eso sumando a que es un gran roster de peleadores, tendrás mucha tela por donde cortar a la hora de elegir un personaje con cual quedarte o practicar las mecanicas de cada uno de ellos, por otra parte, el diseño de los mismos es variado, pero todos con ese aire manga/anime clásico de los japoneses así que esteticamente, tampoco esta mal.

Los comandos responden como deben, por lo que si eres malo jugando, no puedes culpar al juego... ya será cosa de practicar más.
El online es bastante estable y mejoraron algunas cosas, sin embargo, sigue dejando que desear. Es decir, mejoraron el netcode con relación al del CSE, pero no es un online como el de Skullgirls...

Sin duda, es una compra asegurada si eres fan o te llaman la atención los juegos de peleas, es uno de los mejores juegos que he jugado en este ámbito hasta la fecha. Y esta más barato que el SFV.... ah Y ESTE SI TIENE MODO ARCADE!

Мини обзор от игрока казуала: игра хороша, рекомендую всем, но только если вы действительно любите файтинги и готовы заучивать комбы (со стайлишем особо не поиграешь в мультиплеере, ибо там в основном играют отцы, которые даже на 20-60 победах за чампа просто не дают тебе встать и не прощают ни одной ошибки. Удовольствия от такого избиения вы не получите, если вы не мазохист), графика на высоте, сюжет довольно забавен, в стори моде много фановых разветвлений типа отдельного острова для Джина (спойлерить не буду). Персонажей довольно много и все они сильно отличаются (разве что кроме двух роботов, которые раньше были одним), так что любимчика вы себе найдёте. Единственный момент: вам понравится сюжет, если вы фанат новеллок, а если нет, то... Вам остаётся только онлайн и всяческие режимы игры типа arcade-mode. Ах да, мне ещё не понравился не очень информативный тренинг, особенно тренинг персонажей (то есть конкретный тренинг например на Тринити). Спросите почему? Там не удосужились сделать демонстрацию того что надо сделать, а это не всегда очевидно (мне было непонятно что надо сделать за Тринити, чтобы сделать усиленный драйв), решилось чтением вики, но это, как вы понимаете, небольшой минус в копилку игры.

TLDR: игра рекомендуется к приобретению если вы сильный фанат файтингов и хотите стать [strike]шаманом[/strike] файтинг королём, либо если вы казуал и просто хотите пройти стори (на свой страх и риск, но мне это показалось скучным). Если вы не очень в файтингах и не хотите/не можете учить всякие комбы и прочее, то я бы прошёл мимо. При всех плюсах и облегчениях это файтинг и на стайлише вы далеко не уедете. И да, тут полно комплексных механик с различными рапид кэнселами, краш тригерами, контер ассаултами, овердрайвами, барьер блоками, мгновенными блоками... etc. Так что выбирайте осторожно :3.

p.s. И да, у меня лагал мультиплеер до слайдшоу и это дико бесило. Пока сделал рефунд, возможно куплю заново, когда всё пофиксят.

p.p.s. 7.5 Коконоэ из 10 (минус за лагающий мультиплеер и своеобразный тренинг)

21698442.review:
Well, I'm pretty embarrassed while writing this review because I don't know if I would recommend this game or not.
Let's put it this way: if you're fan of Japanese visual novels/anime, then you would still be as pleased as with the previous BlazBlue games. The story is not quite as good as CT or CS but it is decent enough to keep you interested until the end.
The game offers a lot of single player modes like Arcade, Abyss, Score Attack or the fight against a special boss (I won't spoil what it is) and there are many reports of it having a pretty good netcode for online play. And finally, the game doesn't seem to have many major issues running on PC.

Now... the bad news:
- This is just a PC port of the PS3 version which keeps the arcade proportions. Sprites and menus are set to 720p and look extremely ugly and pixelated on higher resolutions. Compatibility sits therefore very uncomfortably between gaming PCs who are too advanced to display it properly and toasters who can't display it at all. It is still playable but... yuck.
- The gameplay. Ok, I know, this is a matter of taste, you either like air-dashers or not blahblah, but I cannot help but find that the BB series has taken a path made of an increasing number of complicated mechanics which are too much for many gamers' minds to take a hold of: Rapid Cancel, Crush Trigger, Counter Assault, Burst, Overdrive, Barrier Block, Instant Block... You can clearly see this game was made in a time when SF4 was still a thing and adding gimmicks to escape or invert any situation was still seen as cool. They know very well they screwed up and that's why they added Stylish mode since CS, which is in my eyes just an acknowledgement of failure in creating an accessible game.
As for the game tutorials, while they are better than CSE ones (particularly the character tutorials) they sadly still look as they were written by fighting game nerds so deeply immersed in their own vocabulary that they aren't aware of the existence of an outside world. Reading an online guide is far less tedious and more practical than going through this.

So I would say, if you're interested in good anime-styled single player content, this can be the game for you. If you happen to be part of the very specific niche who likes technical air-dashers and wanna play online with other enthousiasts of the genre... then you probably already own this game and don't need my advice.
But if you wanna get into fighting other people online and offline, be aware that this game may not be a very welcoming and forgiving experience. The player base is extremely small (I can never find more than 10-15 people in online lobbies a week after launch) and there's a high chance your opponent will be a BB veteran with no compassion for newbies.

I'll give a negative review because it has so many good reviews it won't be counted anyway, and to get downvoted as much as possible.

21692920.review:
It's good to see that ASW are trying some new genres. I was really worried when I first found out that their new game is a "weaboo room sim", because it's rather hard to make a good game in such a special genre.
However, Arc System Works managed to deliver an amazing game (as they always do). 
Even though Arcs specialize in fighting games, the "weaboo room simulator" is one of the best sims I've ever played.
The amount of freedom you get is simply amazing: you can buy dakimakuras, cat-shaped furniture, paint your whole room pink, cover your walls with loli posters and invite/visit you fellow weaboos (or you can make your very own basement with thick metal walls that will prevent your guest from leaving too early no matter how hard they try).

Still, Arcs never forgot about their past and added a small fighting minigame as a homage to their old projects. But let's be honest, why would you ever leave your loli-filled nest?

21692379.review:
It will be a review made by complete n00b in fighting games. I've warned you.

I had a little romance with games like Tekken, Mortal Combat or King of Fighters, but as I said it was just a romance. If we are talking about BlazBlue franchise, then I can clearly tell, that I'm in love.
Gaming Warlocks from Arc System certainly knows how to make good games. They even know how to make sequels far greater than previous games! That's just incredible!

It's hard for me to tell what changed between Continuum Shift and ChronoPhantasma in terms of gameplay (aside from removing Golden Break Bursts, Guard Primers, quicken gameplay a bit, adding Overdrive and replacing Guard Crush with Crush Trigger), but what I'm certain is fact, that combos and special attacks are easier to preform than before. I'm not sure if It's just me becoming pro or something really changed, but mentioning it won't hurt.

AI is finally intelligent and in every mode (except most fights in story mode) it's giving a little chalange to battle them. At least if you are n00b like me.

Now it's time for PLOT! <insert image with boobs here>
Toshimichi Mori serve us again extremly deep, multi-threaded history with TONS of hard to understand things, termology that normally wouldn't had any sense etc. but if you enjoyed story so far, then you will be in heaven. Now story isn't presented from the perspective of a certain character, so you don't need to complete history by fighting as character you don't like... 
At least not that much as in previous games. (BTW. screw you Hakumen!)
Plot is very enjoyable if you like this kind of stories, but there is one controversial thing about, how it is presented. Most people is probably accustomed to a little bit of story, then text, then story, then again fight and so on. ChronoPhantasma have a diffrent proportions from previous games. There is A LOT of text (with kind of funny animations with sprites reminding me of a certain indie game), then a short fight with character being main character at the moment, then again a WALL of text, then again short fight, short cutscene and again TEXT. 
Please, don't misunderstand me. I've enjoyed this story much more than before and for me this proportions made story much more captivating than in CT and CS, but for many people it will be one of the cons of this game.

Ok. Are you still reading? Yes? Oh. I must say, I'm impressed by your endurance! Stay a bit more and there will be your awaited end. Not your end of course.

So, where I left? Oh right! Soundtrack. I have a mixed feelings about it. Most songs from previous games was remade and/or remixed and sometimes they are a lot better than original (e.g Sword of Doom II or Bullet Dance II) but there are songs that is kind of worse than before (e.g Awakening a Chaos II or Xmatic II). Then again, don't misunderstand me. These which for me is worse than original, isn't bad. Just... they aren't fitting my taste anymore. Still, Daisuke Ishiwatari done a great job.

Visuals are pretty as always and still they have this old school arcade feeling. In my opinion, green and colorful Ikaruga gave designers a great range for making stages even more beautiful than before! About characters... I don't think, that something changed between CS and CP, but new Noel's outfit looks great on her.

Now it's time for some cons. Like in Continuum Shift, port from consoles isn't great. You can't find here FullHD support, there few problems with some PC configurations and scalling here is quite bad. But I must tell, I don't really care. Game is great and this port is still better than that of Arkham Knight (lol). If you like fighting games and deep story, then hurry up and buy it!

K'ay. Now we are waiting another 2 or more years for continuation. Eh... Whatever. Gotta go to kick Jin's ass for calling my favorite character a trash.
Oh. Did I mentioned that this game ends with big and fatty cliffhanger? :>

21687542.review:
基本的にはコンシューマ版と同じです。
なのでゲームの主なモードや仕様については公式サイトのゲーム紹介ページ等を見るのが最善です。

ですが違いや一部システムが機能してなかったりもするので、長くなりますがその辺を書いておきます。


・verをCP/CPEXから選択可能ですが、CPはver1.1のみとなっていました。CP1.0の性能では遊べませんので、ご注意を。

・ネット対戦ですが、これはゲーム紹介文にも書いてありますがランクマッチとプレイヤーマッチのみです。ロビーマッチはありません。
プレイヤー数的に仕方ないのかもですが、ロビマは気軽に不特定多数の相手と対戦出来る第三の選択肢として非常に優れたモードと思うので、Steam版に無いのは残念ですね。もしかしたら今後アプデで追加するのかもしれませんが…。

・グッドプレイヤー/バッドプレイヤーリスト自体は存在してるんですが、ランキングや対戦履歴の画面からだと他プレイヤーのDコードが見られない（直接Steamのプロフィールに飛ぶのみ）ので、例えばランクマで対戦しただけの相手をリストに入れる、という事は出来ません。
腕が近くていい勝負が出来る相手（でもわざわざフレ登録するのは面倒）をグッドプレイヤーリストに入れておくとか
あまりにラグが酷かったり舐めプや捨てゲーをしてきたり…というちょっとお断りしたい相手をバッドプレイヤーリストに入れて今後回避するとか、そういうことはできません。
プレマで一緒の部屋になった相手のDコードはプレマにいる間のみ参照可能なので、そこでならグッド/バッドリストに登録可能です。
ここは単なる仕様ミス・片手落ち感があるので、パッチで早く修正してほしい所です。

・対戦は基本的に快適ですが、回線表示がブレやすくややアテにならないことも。あと勿論相手によりますが、ちょっとしたラグがやや発生しやすいかもしれません。

・特典のデジタルサントラですが、収録曲が少ない＆選曲が謎・半端です。

CPアーケードOP・イザヨイのテーマ・アマネのテーマ・バレットのテーマ・アズラエルのテーマ・カグラのテーマ・バング風林火山のテーマ
第七機関のテーマ・六英雄のテーマ・ストーリーモードED・ツバキのテーマ・ノエル対ツバキのテーマ

以上、12曲です。チョイスがよく分からない…。
「セリカとテルミのテーマは入ってるやろー＾＾」と思ってたので結構ガッカリです。
私のようにCPのサントラを持っている人は不要と思います。


大体こんな感じです。
不満や短所を書き連ねてしまいましたが、チュートリアルやトレーニング、ネット対戦周りなどの充実ぶりや快適性は従来通り格ゲー全体で見てもかなり高い水準なので（プレマだけは前作より不便になっていると思いますが）、ブレイブルーに興味のある方やPCでもBBをやりたい方にはオススメ出来ます。値段もお得ですし。

21681273.review:
As far as anime fighters go BBCPEX is one of the most fun, it has a large variety of characters that all play differently, some of them can sneakily hit you full screen and then suddenly cross you up and make you turn off your computer (HAZAMA) while others just destroy you close range with their superior buttons (DELETE AZRAEL PLEASE, ARC) which means theres a character for everybody. 

The system mechanics of the game are good too, like how you can get a buttload of meter really fast but it doesnt cross over to the next round so you can just go balls deep every round without having to conserve anything so everyone is always playing their fullest. 

Netcode is good too, as long as there is 1 bar you shouldn't get any lag, just stay away from 0 bars. I usually play on Ps3 and 90% of the time im playing with the dudes in the japanese arcade lobby with 0 lag so that should say a lot. 

If you're a filthy uncultured swine casual that doesn't play online that's fine too, because the story mode is amazing, it's actually pretty interesting and it has a ton of content, literally has hours of story mode to watch and doesn't get boring. Training mode has all the features you'd want, it has a tutorial mode and a mode that teaches you character specific combos. Get good.

The soundtrack is godlike and the characters are lovable, I only play Rachel, she's amazingly designed and I love her theme (Queen of Rose 2) I cant think of any other fighting game theme I like more than that one, but there's also a ton of other great themes in the game like Under heaven destruction 2 and X-matic 2 to name a few, check them out if you're new to the game but interested in the music. 
Seriously though I listen to this OST all the time, they did a good job.

As far as problems go the pc port has really weird slowdown for me offline when I do a super sometimes, which might just be my computer but if it's not I hope it gets fixed
AND THEY ALSO REMOVED THE ARCADE LOBBY MODE? WHY HAVE YOU FORSAKEN ME ARC? IT WAS SO COOL
right now you can only go to other players rooms, you design a little room like animal crossing and walk around with your avatar (that you can customize) and find other players which you can fight/talk to/spectate etc
it's a very nice way to do lobbies. Revelator needs to do this. All fighters need to do this. Please god.

So in conclusion buy the game if you're a fan of fighters because this does a lot of things right, and buy this game if you're not a competitive fighting game player because the story mode is long as hell and offers a lot, more than most story based games on steam, so buy this game nerds.

21676427.review:
BlazBlue CPEX sur PC !

L'un des rares dernier jeu de baston 2D utilisant encore des sprites (mais un background 3D) et qui bénéficie de tout le savoir d'Arcsys dans ce domaine.
Mecaniques de jeu complexes et variées, un contenu suffisant pour vous occuper pendant des centaines d'heures qui ferait passer SFV pour une démo jouable et un mode online qui fonctionne pas trop mal (à voir selon votre connexion), 
font de ce CPEX un excellent jeu de baston.

Le portage PC est de bonne facture, correctement optimisé et tournera sur des configurations modestes, le gros avantage du PC c'est que vous pouvez utiliser à peu près n'impote quel controlleur (contrairement à la PS4 ou One qui vous obligeront à investir dans un pad/stick licencié par Sony/MS sous peine de devoir utiliser l'atroce d-pad du Dualshock 4 et le bouton de télécommande de la One), et qui dit controlleur dit Hori, Madcatz, NeoGeo pad ou pad Saturn, rien d'autre.
Et vous allez en avoir besoin car CPEX est un chouilla plus rapide de CSEX, le précédent opus de la série et qu'il nécessite donc une rapidité d'execution des combos accrue qui commence à flitrer avec le surhumain pour certains personnages.

Bref, BB CPEX améliore encore la formule BlazBlue et vous procurera des heures de défouloir et de fun, en attendant sa suite: Central Fiction.

When I got CSE on my labtop(which isn't all that powerful.) I was slightly disappointed with the frame rate(going from a low of 35 during astrals or in abyss mode with +50 speed characters to a high of 58-60(which I'm more then happy just getting 45 fps.) Blazblue Chronophantasma extend has maintains a frame rate of 60 fps most of the time during my 19 minutes of play only dropping durin astrals and even then it wasn't jumpy at all. This was the only thing that bothered me on CSE so I'm happy its running so well.

Pros
I think the characters are either more responsive due to the better frame rate I'm having, improvements by Arc system or I might just be a little shocked at how fast ragna felt compared to cse.

Balance changes are usually good for me and I noticed some basic combos that I usually use with ragna did a bit more damage. I'm happy to see my main get some love from Arc system.

Character roster is a nice improvement I'm really happy to see so many new characters(I'm even looking forward to beating the **** out of Terumi with ragna.)

I didn't expect to see the old songs, maps(backrounds?) to be included which is a great bonus for me. 

It was on sales I got it for a great price I didn't expect that I would be able to even get this game for months.

All the dlc is included with some bonus goodies..... Love seeing that on pc.

Cons.... 

I'm down to less then $2 in my steam account..... I couldn't care less about that. :)

Blazblue/10=AWESOME!!!!

21644400.review:
The game is very buggy.

If you have more tha one monitor, it will clip the side of the second one if you set it full-screen.  The resolutions aren't even fully available the first time I booted, and the anti-aliasing is absolute garbage. Using anti-aliasing at all atributes to random slowdowns in menus and Ragna vs. Nu matches, which I find strange.  

The lobbies are more supposedly stable than GG Xrd -SIGN-, which is such a mess that I dropped it, despite really liking it. I mostly play for the story anyways.

Blazblue is a more convoluted story, trying to be more of a visual novel, as well as having multiple "gag" endings.
Blazblue is friendlier to beginners, featuring slower play (Guilty Gear is fairly fast in comparison to buttonpress-timing), and a "Stylish mode" which lets you chew on your controller to crap out really cool looking combos against AI opponents. It's actually what saved me, since I like these games, but I'm simply no good at them.
Blazblue seems to follow a different, brighter colour scheme. Both games have schemes to their colours consistently, with Blazblue being brighter and more attractive. 
Blazblue has some really awesome characters to pick from, with varying movesets to pick from, so even if your favourite/cutest character sucks because you can't do timed hits, you can find someone else who is cool and you get along with.

The price for the game is fair. It's a slightly later release of a console game, and although the port needs improvements, the game does play solid, without crashes on my rig, which was middle-of-the-road about five years ago. I just built a 2000+ dollar monster and I'm a bit disappointed in not being able to make the graphics needle-sharp, but it's still a load of entertainment.

21641132.review:
首先，BBCPEX登陆PC对我来说已经是惊喜了！
然后，本作要想细腻点的全屏游戏，分辨率就得在900P以下。900P往上1080P全屏都会有锯齿，较严重，而且900P以下分辨率最好不要选择FULL，因为画面会拉伸变形而且影响细腻度.
本作节奏比CSEX要激烈的多，快节奏对战也比较符合我的口味，剧情没得说，一直都很棒.
至于联机，跟其他国家的人打是卡的不行的，电信网通对战也会因为地区的不同而有不同的延迟.
联机的最佳环境还是网通打网通，电信打电信，如果有同城联机或者基友一起玩就更好了.
其次，这一代的挑战模式也比较棒，大连段能拆解出很多实用的小连段，通过自己的摸索还能变化出别的实用连段。而且经常打挑战，练套路也对熟练掌握节奏点，精准搓招有很大帮助。
最后，我想说，我是键盘格斗党，我骄傲！233

Blazblue is fun, its mechanics are fun, the game is fun.
The story is the most cheesy, pointlessly complex, nonsense I have ever seen but it's still has charm.

You know what's great about Blazblue?
Say you try Ragna, but you don't like him -- you want more speed: So then you have Taokaka, and Noel.
Say then you want to use setup combos then you have Rachel, and Carl.
Say then you want to play someone a bit more slow then you got Hazama, and Hakumen.
The list goes on but seriously if you get this game: Try to get a friend, and keep trying each character.

I originally thought I'd main Taokaka till I tried Carl Clover, and who knows.
You might think you like some character but then you try someone else and you like them more.
Edit:
To hopefully help out newcomers.
Do the character tutorials, they will teach you so much about whom you're playing and the strategy behind them.

If you feel you found the one, the character that you like to play, then try the character's challenges, even if you can't complete any of them now you can still watch them in action and attempt to learn from them.

21633036.review:
--Introdução--

BlazBlue é a série de Fighting Games mais recente da Arc System. Anteriormente foi trazido o primeiro jogo Calamity Trigger na Steam "capado" da versão "Game for Windows Live", após isso um ótimo port de BlazBlue Continuum Shift Extend foi publicado na Steam no fim de 2014. Nós encontramos em 2016 com o port do BlazBlue caseiro mais recente, Chronophantasma Extend, o port é digno de atenção?

--Conteudo--

Vamos primeiro falar do que o jogo oferece, falando dos personagens temos todos os personagens de Continuum Shift Extend retornando para Chronophantasma Extend, os personagens novos e relembrados são:

Amane Nishiki: Um afeminado membro de uma grupo de atores, ele procura Carl Clover. Seu jogo consiste em causar dano com seu drive, Spiral, focado em dano na defesa.

Bullet: Uma das integrantes de um antigo grupo de mercenários, ela busca respostas com Kokonoe e Relius. O drive "Lockon" dela mostra um "alvo" no oponente que permite ela entrar no modo "Heat-Up" que melhora seus especiais e mobilidade.

Azrael: Vindo do Setor Sete, por ser tão perigoso e violento ele foi preso. Agora libertado ele busca lutadores fortes como Ragna ou os Seis Herois. Seu drive "The Terror" mostra pontos fracos no oponente, com variações altas e baixas.

Izayoi: A forma verdadeira da arma de Tsubaki finalmente se revela, transformando-a. O drive Scarlet Justice faz com que ela mude entre 2 modos, o primeiro focando em aumentar uma barra especial e o segundo para gastar.

v-13: Vaso ruim não quebra e a robozinha retorna de Calamity Trigger com seu gameplay intacto junto de novos golpes. Seu drive Sword Summoner é focado na conjuração de lâminas.

Λ-11: Sumida do Chronophantasma original ao invés de ser simplesmente uma versão nerfada de v-13 de Calamity Trigger ela agora conta com uma variação em que suas lâminas contam com 2 hits e outros propriedades diferentes em seus golpes, focando mais em manter pressão no canto e ficando mais "perto" do oponente.

Kagura Mutsuki: O atual líder da familia Mutsuki do grupo Duodecim, um dos raros "caras do bem" dentro da NOL. Ele tem comandos de charge e o drive Black Gale permite mudar seu estilo de luta.

Kokonoe: Finalmente a cientista sai do seu laboratório, a filha de Jubei e Nine usa o poder da ciência para lutar. Graviton permite ela ponha um dispositivo na arena que gera campos gravitacionais.

Yuuki Terumi: Um dos antigos seis herois, sendo jogável após ser separado de Hazama por questões de enredo. O seu novo drive Force Eater permitem um grande ganho na barra de especial, o que é importante pois ele é um dos personagens que contém o maior numero de Distortion Drives da série.

Celica A. Mercury: A dita "Chronophantasma" (ou pelo menos um dos usos) da Celica original, ela "luta" do lado da marionete Minerva, que é seu Drive. Um personagem mais focado para iniciantes ou preguiçosos.

Uma feature interessante citada na parte da v-13 o game na steam tem como exclusividade você jogar com as versões Chronophantasma 1.1 original como o mais notável uma versão basicamente quebrada de Kokonoe e a robozinha homicida com sua troca de "poses" tendo um leque maior de golpes trocando por dano mas ganhando por versatilidade. O modo só pode ser utilizado no VS, Training e Online quando configurado

-Story Mode-

O modo de enredo foi revisto, ao invés de cada personagem ter sua rota agora são apenas 3: Chronophantasma, Setor Sete e Seis Herois. Os enredos agora fazem "um pouco" mais de sentido e há uma coerência de cronologia e interação de personagens porém sinto que há menos lutas e os ganhos não foram tão grandes, quem curte mais os vilões se sentirá desapontado em não poder jogar com Hazama e v-13 por exemplo.

Outra crítica é de ser obvio demais que as escolhas de enredo dessa vez simplesmente são continuar o enredo ou ver uma gag route, não há escolhas erradas e falhar em batalha não há textos novos do que um prompt para tentar novamente...também não permite você fazer uma das rotas todas do inicio ao fim, você precisa jogar as 3 para habilitar novos capitulos em todos o que deixa menos interessante.

Há novos gag reels e histórias mais focadas em Bullet, Kokonoe e Kagura de novidades do Extend, também tem o retorno de "teach me Litch" com uma revisada sobre termos e eventos no geral até antes de Chronophantasma, junto deste também há dois rápidos resumos dos eventos de Calamity Trigger e Continuum Shift narrados por Rachel e seus dois servos porém não são tão bons quanto o resumo de CT em BBCSE. A adaptação do mangá Remix Heart é um modo história separado que conta aventuras na época do colégio do pessoal da Noel contando com novos personagens com Mai Natsume e Kajun Faycott.

-Abyss Mode-

Ele foi revisto em comparação ao BBCSE deixando mais divertido, as punições não são mais tão severas (você não perde mais stats ganhos do personagem), não é preciso recomprar sempre stats e os buffs idem além que agora eles são "equipáveis" depois de comprar uma vez no shop deixando mais dinâmico.

Não há mais apenas um "abismo", há vários com seus temas, dificuldades e variações de prêmios dependendo de qual for jogar, deixando mais variado o gameplay, o que é ótimo pois assim como em BBCSE esse será o modo em que você irá passar mais tempo para conseguir os pontos e habilitar o que quer no modo Gallery.

-Network Mode-

Infelizmente a má notícia: assim como em Guilty Gear XRD o modo "Online Lobby" foi deletado. Não acredito ter sido uma perda tão grave pois apesar de boas idéias esses lobbies normalmente só se populam mesmo nos primeiros meses, após isso se tornam desertos com apenas 1, 2 tendo uma população aceitável. ASW sabe que com versão PC isso esvaziaria mais rápido ainda então preferiram se focar em ranked e player lobbies.

O netcode em si ficou no positivo, achei um pouco melhor quando há uma conexão boa mas um pouco pior quando há atraso. NOVAMENTE NA PRIMEIRA LUTA COM UMA PESSOA NO LOBBY DEIXAM TODA A INTRO DE CENÁRIO E PERSONAGENS ACABAREM PARA SINCRONIZAR MELHOR E DAR MENOS CHANCES DE LAG, os jogadores agradecem.

Ranked admito que não testei muito, acredito que todas as features de BBCSE estejam ali.

Player Match o interessante é que você pode customizar seu avatar, seu cartão de jogador e até o quarto que você convida, podendo personalizar com diversos moveis e apetrechos. Gostaria que tivesse mais opções de deixar como uma casa de jogos/fliperamas mas...há diversas regras de salas para editar porém acredito que podiam ter colocado esquemas como "first to #" nelas.

-Outros modos-

Há highlander mode em que você enfrenta um novo oponente proveniente dos momentos finais do story mode, agora não só limitado aos personagens principais. Temos também o clássico Survival, Score Attack com novas rotas entre outros sem muitas novidades.

O modo Library é um wikipedia de termos do jogo que pode ser interessante para tirar duvidas de certos aspectos de blazblue, notável também que há uma seção especifica para termos de fighting games.

--Controle--

Feliz ou infelizmente não houve muitas mudanças, controles de direct input funcionam mas ainda com botões trocados como start e select, precisando uma reeducação mental e uma reconfiguração de botões antes de jogar. Xinput funciona normalmente e teclado permitem reconfigurar botões e setas normalmente.

--Palavras Finais--

Resumindo: O port é tão competente como o de BBCSE com adição da revisão BBCP 1.1 para curiosos ou sadosistas de certas versões de personagens. Caso tenha BBCSE o game é recomendadissimo caso curta BlazBlue, caso queira começar com esse pelo enredo é ainda recomendável comprar BBCSE antes pois este BlazBlue não resume tão bem os enredos anteriores.

Apesar de novamente a demora (apesar dela ter sido menor que BBCSE) ainda um ótimo trabalho feito pela Arc System Works na Steam.

21629266.review:
http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=637985869

BlazBlue: Chronophantasma Extend - это лучшая часть в серии. До неё я таковой считал Continium shift, но когда вышла хронофантазма - континиум шифт улетел далеко-далеко, ибо хрофантазма круче его во всём.

1.Новые Персонажи.
Пожалуй, это наиважнейший параметр файтинга. Здесь добавили аж 9 новых персонажей, + полностью редизайнули Ноэль, добавив ей и остальным персонажам много новых приёмов. Итак кто же эти новички:
- Аманэ - ТРАП, ТрадиционныйЯпонскийТанцовщик, тусующийся со своим личным бойзбэндом, так же состоящим исключительно из трапов в кимано. Однозначно, самый ГЕЙСКИЙ персонаж всей франшизы, за него банально неприятно играть. Дерется он какими-то непонятными ленточками. Но, имеет самую потрясную музыкальную тему из всех новичков.
- Азраэль - брутальный мужик, нереально силен и крут. Являлся подопытным заложником профессора Коконоэ (розовой кошкодевки). Дерется руками. В основном захватами.
- Баллет - невероятно фигуристая тян, с пафосным шрамом на лице и очень сексуальными шортиками про которые все шутят даже в игре. Имеет то ли протез, то ли механическую перчатку стреляющую лазером. Дерется руками.
- Кагуро - САСКЕ из наруты, брутальный альфач и бабник. Имеет огроменный меч и такое же ЧСВ. Перед боем с тянками оценивает их ОСНОВНЫЕ КАЧЕСТВА.
- Коконоэ - она же профессор Коконоэ, розоволосая кошкодевка, которая отдает приказы Тайгеру. Начиная с этой части - играбельна. Ведет себя как хипстер. Дерется всякими клевыми штуками. Играть за нее - просто афигенно.
- Селика. Тянка с очень интересной предысторией, способной порвать ваши шаблоны о целой серии. Вместо неё сражается кукла-помощник, как у Карла или Релиуса. Но фишка в том, что деремся мы именно роботом, а не Селикой.
- Изайой - супер имбовая форма для Тцубаки. В ней она сражается лазерным копьём и умеет менять стиль боя (на кнопку "С"). А еще она классно выглядит.
- Теруми - истинная форма и имя Хазамы, главгад серии. Имбовый персонаж, с взрывающими жопу скиллами. Дерется тем же чем и Хазама, но делая упор на пинки под жопу и топтание.
- Лямбда. Тупо перекрашенная Ню. С такими же скиллами и ультой. Даже выглядит так же.

2.Мультиплеер.
Это тот редкий случай, когда разрабы сделали невероятно крутецкий мультиплеер работающий стабильно и адекватно. Очень радует новое лобби, которое можно украшать по своему усмотрению, а так же заходить в чужие лобби и смотреть как все выглядит у других людей.

3.Сюжет.
Возможно для кого-то этот пункт не важен, но фанатам серии (как мне например) этот пункт был первым по важности. Сюжет ей богу не скатился а только набрал еще более клевые обороты. Наблюдать за развитием сюжета так же интересно как и раньше, но к сожалению все портят однобразные стычки, и порой затянутые диалоги. Но благо сюжетка не такая долгая, и потому пролетает за 5-6 часов.
Теперь сюжетный режим состоит из хронологических линий 3х точек зрения, которые вконце переплетаются в одну единую. Помимо основного сюжета, имеются предыстории нескольких персонажей, СМИЩНЫЕ гэговские эпизоды и невероятно странный филлер под названием "Heart Remix". Суть этого филлера я так и непонял, хотя гг мелькающий там появится в новом BlazBlue в качестве играбельного персонажа.

4.Музыка.
Все такая же потрясная. Почти весь старый саундтрек заремиксили, некоторая музыка звучит еще круче, некоторая хуже. Но это не мешает вам разлочить старые композиции и использовать их в сетевых боях. Каждому своё, как говориться.

5.Геймплей.
Теперь всё быстрей, веселей и круче. Так же механику игры апнули, теперь есть такая фишка как Unlimited, и много чего другого про что вы сами узнаете в обучалке. Скажу лишь, благодаря всему этому играть (уже в третий раз, по сути в ту же самую игру, только с модами) стало гораздо интереснее.

В заключении скажу, что игрой я очень доволен. Я купил её в первый же день релиза в стиме и ни разу не пожалел. Игра стоит своих денег, ибо контента в ней очень много. Потрясная игра, 10 лазурных гримуаров из 10. Будем надеятся, что следующие части не скатятся.

21621310.review:
我来讲一些第一次玩容易遇到的问题。
1，键位问题，首先这个游戏有1号键位和2号键位。1号键位在小键盘的位置，2号键位是WASD，如果想调用2号键位开始游戏就用TAB进入标题画面（如果用回车进入标题就是1号键位也就是小键盘）。2号键位下确认是U，取消是I，故事模式快进是E，暂停是TAB。
2，配置差战斗起来卡，设置-画面相关，把光泄和反锯齿设置成OFF，这样还卡电脑就没救了
3，动画卡，如果你玩过BBCS并且有不卡的动画，参照它的详细属性把CP的动画也全部用转码工具改成一样的属性（高和宽，帧速率，比特率）。
4，建御雷神贴图错误，这个我还没找到解决方法，谁解决了希望可以教教我- -

总的来说是一个不错的游戏，剧情太赞，故事模式已经通关，期待BBCF的后续发展，还有欢迎加好友一起玩（我是网通的），网上匹配好卡……

21618085.review:
whoa a good blazblue game

the plot is still stupid as usual, and if you have lots of free time, you're gonna eat it all up. if you missed out on the past games, but care about this convoluted mess of a story, there's a recap. you arent even done here with the story tho since we have a new BlazBlue game coming, annnd the side materials like Bloodedge Experience, XBlaze, etc.

= Pros =
+  Fast-paced gameplay. 
+ Great soundtrack. You can also unlock the original tracks, and use the over the remixes in player matches, which, in my opinion, is still so much better.
+ Really good 2D sprites.
+ For casual players, there are many offline modes. Here for the lore? Play Story Mode, and watch Teach Me! Miss Litchi. Just here for the gameplay, but don't wanna play online? Score Attack. Arcade. Abyss.
+ And with those many offline modes above, you'll be spending lots of time offline too, beating and unlocking everything. There are in-game currency, and you can use it to buy new palettes, Unlimited versions, illustrations, old BGM, and more!
+ Accessible to beginners. There's Stylish Mode if you just want to mash your ways offline, but I discourage you from using it online. Tutorial Mode is super helpful, and Challenge Mode will teach you a few combos.
+ A large cast. You'll find a character you like to play sooner or later.
+ If you're a vanilla CP player, and wanna relive the glory of Kokonoe, here you go. You can play vanilla CP mode offline.
+ A LOT MORE BALANCED THAN CS. THANK GOD RACHEL ISN'T LOW-TIER ANYMORE.

= Cons =
Honestly really tried to find flaws, but... they're just so tiny compared to the pros.

- It's super accessible, sure, but mastering everything is difficult. Might be a pro, since that means you'll be investing more time gitting gud at this game.
- Everything might seem intimidating to beginners at first.
- Network Mode is... a bit laggy. Better than CS, but if you live far, there's gonna be input lag.  (Wiring your internet might fix this, but if you don't have a network cable...)
- Searching for lobbies or ranked matches are regionlocked. As a Southeast Asian player, I rarely find matches online.
- Most players I've encountered aren't really aware they're NOT supposed to skip intros. Man, fighting 5 Ragnas in a row on ranked--THAT ALSO SKIP INTROS--sure was fuuuuuuuuuuuunnnnn.

TL;DR it's a good fighting game for both casuals and competitive players. online might be difficult if you're in a certain region, but you'll eventually find people to play with. its story mode is pretty much a visual novel on its own. and of course, lots of waifus and husbandos...

21612107.review:
Thanks ASW/H2 for the great port.

Pros:
+ Latest BB available on consoles, now on PC. for cheap. (BBCF is still only on JPN arcades atm)
+ Online mode works. Yes, a working online mode. In 2016. Isn't that amazing?
+ One of the best, if not the best, netcode.
+ DirectInput Support.
+ Single player content. TONS of them. (Arcade, Story mode, Challenge, Abyss, Score Attack, Unlimited Mars, Challenge, Training, an extra story mode, and a couple of stuff for newcomers)
+ Tutorial will show you the ropes and Challenge mode can make you master some complex combos.
+ Great gameplay. Kinda hard at first, but it's all fun after that.
+ Tons of chars, each one with a unique gameplay.
+ It's not Street Fighter.
+ Contains all DLCs from the console.
+ Can change the annoying default system voice to many others. desuno!
+ Great soundtrack. (subjective)
+ Customize your lobby to look fab.
+ Can play BBCP instead of BBCPE if you want. We love you kokonoe :3
+ EU players don't have to wait a whole year :v
+ Amazing story mode (subjective). Now with the obligatory beach episode, plus a recap episode (for CT/CS events)...
+ Celica. Izayoi.

Cons: (trying to be picky, they're mostly non-issues)
- No online cross-play with consoles. Online might feel like a ghost town sometimes, as most ppl interested in the game already got it on consoles aeons before this PC release.
- I don't have a 5:3 monitor, so any resolution i pick will look weird (with black bars on corners or stretched image. Arcade resolution is 1280x768).
- 720p sprites look weird unless im on 768p windowed or lower...
- No resolution option above 1080p, in case you wanted to make your 720p sprites look even worse. (EDIT: Thanks, uh, Batman for pointing out that you can edit it in the DisplaySetting.cfg in your Documents folder)
- Low quality OP video. It's as if PCs had limited HD...
- Can't customize the accept/cancel buttons for menu.
- Terumi. Bang.

Conflicted:
* So many characters, it makes it harder for newcomers to learn all them matchups...
* Not so mod-friendly. Because, sprites.
* The included "OST" is SONG INTERLUDE II album ( http://vgmdb.net/album/38796 ) + 2 Tsubaki themes (Condemnation Wings II and Memory of Tears II). Just to let ppl know what this "OST" actually is.
* Platinum. Mai.

21608346.review:
[h1] [b] Preface [/b] [/h1]

This review is for everyone all-around review and is condensed. I however have a full version of my review on the link below here which includes both a "Newcomers" Review and a "Returning Player" Review going indepth. My review on this game is lengthy mainly because there's a lot to talk about (and I love it). Finally have my hours in so I can safely review. 

Enjoy

http://steamcommunity.com/app/388750/discussions/0/

-----------------------------------------------------------------

[h1] [b] Introduction [/b] [/h1]

Hello Everyone, I’ve been really excited to make this review for so long! For anyone who’s been on the forums, we’ve loved talking about what we were planning to do in this game and now it’s here!

I’ve poured my heart and soul into this review to help give you the best idea of what this game is, why I think it’s great, and why at the very least, you should try it. 

For those worried of a “terrible port”. The company literally delayed this game a few times and pushed it back a month to make sure it worked properly. We also had something to let us know they were working on it. Dedication to the fanbase right there.

[h1] [b] Story [/b] [/h1]
---------------------------------------------------

The main selling point of Blazblue to many would have to be its story. The complexity of Blazblue offers a person several different possibilities, but with only one true way. When you play the game’s storyline, you’re presented with various options. Whether you beat the person and kill him, or lose but still have the story continue. There are also choices you can make further increasing the possible routes. There is also not really a “main” character almost, as each person in the game all have individual storylines to playthrough with individual options and outcomes. There is a ton of things to do for people who like to complete 100% on each available character (different outcomes). 

The issue many people seem to have with the game is the story can be confusing. In previous titles, there were shifts in time which made it extremely difficult to pinpoint when something was happening. To newer players I saw however: Don't stop trying to understand this. It's got one of the best storylines in a game, and in fact, it explains the "cliff notes" of the previous two titles to help you understand! This game's plot wasn't as complicated however which led myself kinda sad considering the complexity of the previous titles. The fun of just figuring out the story was one of the reasons why Blazblue became so addicting in the first place. 

Voice acting is stellar as always with my personal favorite being Hazama. Every character has a unique voice to which  they have as well. This adds to the better immersion of the game and its very fun to listen to some of the characters interactions. Some VO were changed however which was sad (I.E. Bang) and they don't sound the best. The majority of the cast do however.

 [h1] [b] Gameplay [/b] [/h1]
------------------------------------------------

I have great news for both casual fighters and veteran fighters which I’m pointing out right now than later. This game has two different mode options: Technical and Stylish. The first is where you do the manual input of all the commands. The second one (PAY ATTENTION CASUALS) allows you to pull off combos by hitting one button. ONE BUTTON. That means you don’t have to be moving your joystick around a bunch, getting messed up over forgetting that one part of a combo, now you can combo like a pro without having to do advanced joystick and button moves. This makes it so that even casual fighting player can take on a veteran. Now that I’ve said it, moving on.

The game’s fighting style is the typical 2d fighting with twists. Your button layout can be customized to whatever you prefer as well. Now, I’ve never been a huge fan of “fighting games” as I’m terrible at them. When I first purchased Continuum Shift, I really hated the fact that I was terrible and had to turn the AI down to easy in order to get anywhere. However, thanks to the various options of button layout, being able to choose style or technical gameplay, I’ve slowly gotten better. The AI difficulty can range from Beginner to Very Hard. This is great for casual and veterans alike.

The fighting moves are the typical fight: Light, Medium, Heavy, and special. You can also perform Distorion drives (speical) and Astral Heat (ending special). 

[h1] [b] Online Play [/b] [/h1]
-------------------------------------------------
This brief saying is for the competitive people. Again, I’ve never really been into “online” play much as I’m terrible with fighting games. However, one of the things that Blazblue does well which other games do not is a standout.
The netcode is practically better than console. There is almost no input lag period. Anyone who loves online play fighters will cheer for this because Blazblue does it extremely well. There are leaderboards also included for tracking player stats. Due to the fact that this game isn’t the most “popular” with the world as is should be, sometimes finding people can be a little hard.

[h1] [b] Music [/b] [/h1]
------------------------------------------------
Many people who’ve played this game LOVE the music. Myself, while I don’t entirely enjoy rock/metal, Blazblue has always done it in a way where I do like it. That for me is a plus. As with previous titles, you can listen to the soundtrack anytime on your computer by going to the CP folder. This addition is great for all Blazblue players who enjoy the game. 

Some of the themes in Blazblue have been replaced with new remixes like Terumi for example. Depending on your preference, this can be either good or bad. The opening is still as wonderful as ever with the intro music being probably one of the best ones ever. It really gets you pumped for playing the game!


[h1] [b] Conclusion [/b] [/h1]
------------------------------------------------------
All-in-all, the game delivers nicely and should not be overlooked as another typical fighting game. You have a great story, fun gameplay for new and old fighting players, a wonderful unlock system, and plain fun as well. I give this my personal recommendation and advise you buy it. If you’re not looking to spend money just yet, you could wait till Calamity Trigger goes on sale for about $2 and try it at the very least.

21603704.review:
[h1]除了那些屠夫，其实还不错[/h1]
79元，11G的游戏，一首听起来不错的OP.
[spoiler]以及11G里可能有8G的动画 [/spoiler]
[h1]再次好评！[/h1]
虽然有很多读起来生硬的地方，但汉化的确做得可以。
---------------------------------------------------------
然后，随便聊聊。
这个系列，我仅仅玩过一作厄运扳机（没记错吧），而本作系统与其基本上都是一致的。
缓缓地推教学，感觉到这教学还是蛮用心的。
分成两部分，一个速成教学，把本作重要的几个系统说明出来；另一个详细的初中高三级教学，把全部系统详细的解释。
我玩FTG也很久了，当然，我接触的游戏不多，这是我第一次遇到如此详细的游戏教学。
[spoiler]之前玩的的铁拳6教学也没有这么详尽。[/spoiler]
然后是配音，我比较了好几个角色的英配合日配，英配听着都差不多，听不出来有什么特别的。而日配相比之下真的好。
支持ARC~能在PC上玩到本作我挺高兴的，但是自己手残了，坚持吧~毕竟FTG是我最喜欢的游戏类型。
最后
如果说缺点，就是感觉本作看着不清晰，总觉得狗牙十分多，而且不支持高清输出，分辨率有点低。
而且音乐并不出彩，听了一遍bgm，没有那种一听就喜欢的。

最后，象征性的打分
信仰 80/100
画面 75/100
系统 90/100 （很标准的取消/投技/必杀技/超必杀技/盾/强制取消/破防等FTG系统）
音乐 60/100
音效 80/100
语音 100/100
简中 100/100
联机 100/100

[spoiler]红中/立直 闷声大发财 100/100[/spoiler]

21600772.review:
There is so much more content in this that its predecessors that absolutely makes its value worthy.
You continue on the story as usual with multiple branches that has different impact and ending.
They have the Library with every single Glossary detail if you are new to the series and want to know about everything. It is really detailed and interesting to read.
There is even more humor bits and story like "Remix Heart Gaiden" and everyones favourite "Teach Me More, Miss Litchi"
Graphics is the same though there are improvements.
More fighters in the roosters which is a welcome addition. It brings to a total of 28. Each are unique with they own strength and weakness. Some require more skill when used on "Technical" as their Combo is pretty hard to pull off or just hard to actually play them. Example Haku-men.
You get all the DLCs from the Console version without additional cost + the Original Sountrack which is rare to many JP Games as usually they have License Trouble.
20% Loyalty Discount for anyone who loved this series though will expired on the 10th March of this Review.
A Very solid port with very little issues on bugs that won't affect your gameplay experience.
The game is very friendly to beginners with its Tutorial and the use of "Stylish" which auto-combos for you but its disable when playing Online. Its really does help teaches you how to play and very friendly in terms of explanation. 
Beware you do not put the COM Difficulty to 100, it will literally beat your ass to the ground. 
Network mode has this Lobby room where you can customize your room. Its like a friendly lobby for people to come in and go rather than the plain Lobby. 
Haven't really tried it very much as the Story and Arcade is far more important due to preference.
Voice acting is godly. Even though people prefer the Japanese Voice, the English Voice are absolutely top notch quality.

Now, if only they would bundle the series.....

Some minor issues related to GPUs cfg, but it can be fixed.

The game is working well, with no stutters or drops. The graphics have been retouched once again, with new stages, sprites, particles, sounds and effects. The gameplay is fluid and responsible, from the re-balance of old characters to the introduction of new ones, more moves and mechanics such as Overdrive and Crush Trigger.

The soundtrack and voices have been redone aswell, and there's plenty of modes to choose from. The tutorials, challenges and trainings alike are even clearer for new players, with options such as detailed inputs and slowdown on combo parts.

This game is totally worth picking up, for the great sprites and artworks, for the advanced mechanics, for the great storyline and diversity of playstyle coming from each character. There's plenty of content to look at. As a fan myself I couldn't be happier.

YES, PLEASE!

On a technical level,
+My Hori Mini 3 works just like it did on CS Extend
+Feels more responsive than CS Extend
+Netcode is wonderful (PLEASE let the intro play before the match starts)
+Despite not being listed on the system requirements, works great on Windows 10

-No cross-platform play

As a port, it's great. More of the fast-paced, flashy anime fighting gameplay you've seen since the first iteration and more.  Here's hoping Central Fiction comes out on Steam as well!

21596232.review:
Mini Review Blazblue Chrono Phantasma Extend สิ้นสุดการรอคอย สำหรับชาว PC...ในที่สุดก็ลง Steam ซักที
(ผิดพลาดประการใด ขออภัย เพิ่งเคยทำReviewครั้งแรก)

Blazblue Chrono Phantasma Extend เกม Fighting + Visual Novel จาก Arc System works ยังคงเป็นรูปแบบ 1vs1 เหมือนเดิม เพิ่มเติมคือ เพียบ! อ่านข้างล่างเอาละกัน

-ตัวละครภาคนี้เพิ่มขึ้นจากภาคก่อน (Continuum Shift) รวมเป็น 28 ตัวละคร (เล่นกันจุใจ) (ภาคหน้ายังมีอีก...อีกนานกว่าจะได้เล่น)
-นอกจากฉากต่อสู้ภาคใหม่แล้ว ของภาคก่อนๆก็ยังมีเหมือนกัน
-ในเรื่องของเพลง มีเพิ่มหลายเพลง ส่วนเพลงประจำตัวละครภาคที่แล้ว จะมีการ Remix ใหม่ แต่ Version ก่อนก็ยังมี
-โหมดการต่อสู้ เหมือนภาคก่อน แต่มีการปรับเปลี่ยนเพิ่มเติมเล็กน้อย เพิ่มแค่โหมดเดียว สู้กับบอส NPC
-มีลูกเล่นที่เพิ่มเติมขึ้นมา เด่นๆอย่าง Overdrive ที่เพิ่มความสามารถและความแกร่ง Strong! ของตัวละครในระยะเวลาหนึ่ง
-โหมด Online/Network สามารถสร้างห้อง เป็นของตัวเอง / Lobby มีหลากหลาย Lobby หลายฉาก / มี Accessories อย่างเพียบ และยังชวนคุย ชวนไฝว์กับชาวบ้านได้
-System Requirement เหมือนกับภาคที่แล้ว
-Graphic ไม่มีอะไรมาก คล้ายๆภาคก่อน แต่ฉากที่เป็น anime อยากให้ปรับปรุงนิดนึง
-Story มีหลากหลายเรื่องราว อยากให้ไปดูเอาเอง (ไม่อยาก spoil)
-และถึงจะไม่เคยเล่นภาค Chrono Phantasma 1 ก็ยังมีระบบนี้ให้เล่นนี้ด้วย (เฉพาะ VS , Training, Network) แต่จะไม่มี 2 สาว Celica , Lambda อยู่ในระบบนี้

ถ้าถามว่าเล่นยากมั๊ย ไม่รู้...ฝึกคอมโบเอาละกัน ตัวละครมันยากง่ายไม่เท่ากัน

ใครที่เคยเล่นภาคก่อนๆ หรืออยากเล่นเกมนี้ เตรียมตังค์ให้พร้อม แล้วซื้อมาเล่นกัน

21593771.review:
BlazBlue Chronophantasma Extend is the is the second installment of Chronophantasma series. This version still carries the legacy of great tutorials for players just starting and players trying to reach that next level. The tutorial does a great job at making complex things easy to understand, so fear not newbies. In addition to the great tutorial the game also features character specific tutorials where the game explains the core characteristics of the character you're trying to learn and teaches you how to play neutral game.

Not a big online fighter? Thats fine, the story mode will also keep you occupied for hours as it behaves like a visual anime novel with animated cutscenes and dialogue choices.
 There are also bonus single player modes such as "Teach me Ms. Litchi!" Score Attack, Abyss and Unlimited Mars that you pose a challenge to you. You may also compete for top scores in these modes on the leaderboards. 

As for the online play there is great connectivity and lag spikes are at a mimimum. To keep your online play as smooth as possible be sure to join lobbies that are within your region/country. If you are making a lobby then name your lobby in the region that you live.

If you're looking to buy a fighting game that will be active in the long run then this is definitely one of them. The PC community has wanted Chronophantasma on Steam for years so I do not see it dying off anytime soon. So what are you waiting for? Terumi needs his butt kicked!

21593748.review:
Are you looking for a well rounded and polished fighter thats easy to pick up and tough as nails to master? Do you look for a challenging fighting game  and an alternative to the yet to be finished SFV? Then you might want to take a peek at this Beat'em'up gem. 

The graphic style sure aint for anybody (well if ur into anime like me you'll love this game anyway ^^) but if you look behind the graphics you'll find an extremely deep fighting game with an incredible amount of combos and mechanics to beat the living hell out of ur opponent or defend yourself against merciless combos. 

I really wouldn't be recommending this game for beginners when it comes to the normal style where you have to input all of your combos manually but luckily there is the stylish mode which makes comboing quite easy to a certain point and gives beginners a good opportunity to enjoy this game to the fullest as well. It even features a pretty good tutorial, one for the core mechanics and one for each characters besides the usual Challenge missions. 

It's a very fun game and if ur into fighting games this game simply is a must have. If you think about looking into fighting games then this game is a good starting point. If it wasn't for the rather outdated graphical options (window looks way better than fullscreen and there is no borderless window available) I'd give this a 10/10 but as it is it certainly still deserves a very good 9/10.

21593397.review:
Pros:
1. Good netplay, I went to ranked match straight away and never had to wait to find a match. Only 1 match was laggy out of about 25 and that's because I forgot to set my connection quality restrictions. (Using a wired connection not wireless. Don't play fighting games on wireless if you can help it.)
2. Runs really well for me, constant 60 FPS at 1920x1080 (GTX 970). Game looks better in "arcade" mode instead of "widescreen".
3. Comes with all of the DLC.
4. Has a great tutorial and challenge mode to teach you how to play the game and the characters.
5. Has a lot of content to offer besides multiplayer (looking at you SFV). Arcade, Story, training, Abyss, Unlimited mars, etc. 
6. Character design and animation is top notch.
7. Every character has an OverDrive which allows for really unique combos.

Cons:
1. BlazBlue in general can be difficult to learn if you're new, and some people online are already good from PS4 version.
2. Highest resolution is 1920x1080, doesn't bother me but may be a con to some.

21589682.review:
A Dated game but still worth a look

I'm not the best fighting game player and over the years Arcsys managed to attract me to Blazblue with its interesting characters, its anime like artstyle and engrosingly deep character back stories. So even if you are not the best at the stick if you are looking for intregue in a story rich universe you might give it a bash. However there are a few short comings in this age.

The Mixed bag:

It is a console port so some limitations are expected. The problem is when you no longer adhere to the once console limits of 1080p and cross into the realm of 1440p, 4k, ultrawide, 100hz+ refresh rates you will be disappointed to find that the game is upscaled from 720p60fps. It looks very dated for more reasons than just this fact. 

The game uses beaulifully and detailed sprite animations and the effort is clearly visiable as each character feel. That said it was still designed with a low res in mind with no high detailed models and down sampling. The other thing to take note of is that Guilty Gear Xrd was released not too long ago sporting full poly models making even 1080p look managable and frankly giving the characters more depth.

The story mode will be the meat for those not into the competitive scene yet unlike BB CS it does not contrain the previous story modes. You will have to get both Continuum Shift and Chronophantasma if you want to see where we are and how we got to this point.

Character design and backstory really shines as certain characters will have different face off chatter to the norm under cerstain conditions. This adds to the feel that the characters know each other and has a deeper connection. 

If you can forgive the lack of catering to newer specced PCs but want more of the BB universe or just a fighting game with a deep story mode, then Chronophantasma is worth a look.

21587465.review:
"BlazBlue: Chronophantasma" นับได้เป็นเกมในลำดับที่ 3 ของ BlazBlue Series ดังนั้นผมขอแนะนำให้คุณเริ่มต้นจาก Calamity Trigger และ Continumm Shift อันเป็นสองตอนก่อนหน้า (ซึ่งมีวางจำหน่ายบน Steam เช่นกัน) ก่อนที่จะมาสัมผัสเกมนี้ มิฉะนั้นแล้วนอกจากคุณจะไม่เข้าใจในเนื้อหาในส่วนของ Story Mode ที่ดำเนินต่อจากสองตอนก่อนหน้าแล้ว คุณอาจจะโดน Spoil อย่างหนักจนทำเอาไม่คิดอยากย้อนกลับไปสัมผัสกับสองผ่านก่อนหน้าได้ (ซึ่งนับได้เป็นการตัดสินใจที่ผิดพลาดอย่างแรง เกมออกจะเก่าไปสักหน่อย แต่ผมยืนยันว่าสองเกมก่อนหน้าเป็นเกมที่เยี่ยมทั้งคู่และคุณควรที่จะลองสัมผัสดูถ้ามีโอกาส)

Chronophantasma อาจจะเป็นเกม Fighting แต่ก็เหมือนดังเช่น Continumm Shift อันเป็นภาคก่อนหน้า ด้วยระบบ Stylish ที่ทำให้คุณกระโดดเตะต่อยปล่อยพลังเข้าใส่ศัตรูได้ง่าย ๆ โดยการกดเพียงแค่ปุ่มเดียวพร้อมโยกทิศทาง ต่อให้คุณจะเป็น Casual Fighter คุณก็สามารถที่จะเล่นเกมนี้ได้สนุกอยู่ (กระนั้นมันก็ค่อนข้างจะขัดกับสามัญสำนึกของเกมแนว Fighting โดยทั่ว ๆ ไปพอสมควร ดังนั้นถ้าคุณเป็นชาว Hardcore ในสายนี้ ผมจึงไม่ค่อยอยากจะแนะนำ) โดยระบบต่าง ๆ ใน Chronophantasma จัดได้ว่า "ดีกว่า" Continumm Shift พอสมควร ซึ่งถ้าคุณชอบภาคก่อนหน้า คุณก็คงจะหลงรัก Chronophantasma เป็นอย่างมากจนไม่คิดอยากถอยกลับไปเล่นภาคก่อนหน้าเลยทีเดียว

ในส่วนของ Features อื่น ๆ นอกจากระบบการเล่นแบบ Arcade และ VS แล้ว ตัวเกมยังคงมี Story ที่ดำเนินต่อจาก Continumm Shift จริงอยู่ที่ว่า Story ของภาคนี้ค่อนข้างที่จะเป็นเส้นตรงกว่าภาคก่อน แต่เนื้อหาก็ยังคงสนุกและคุ้มค่าที่จะติดตามเหมือนเคย นอกจากนี้ระบบต่าง ๆ ที่เคยมียังถูกปรับปรุงให้ดียิ่ง ๆ ขึ้นไปอย่างมากอีกด้วย อีกทั้งเนื้อหาเสริมยังถูกใส่มาไว้ครบ ดังนั้นคุณจึงไม่จำเป็นต้องกังวลว่าจะต้องจ่ายเพิ่มอีกในภายหลังแต่อย่างใด ถ้าคุณต้องการที่จะเก็บรายละเอียดเกมให้ได้ทั้งหมด ดูท่าแล้วคุณอาจจำเป็นที่จะต้องใช้เวลาหลายสิบชั่วโมงเลยทีเดียวกว่าจะสำเร็จและสำหรับชาว Visual Novel ต่อให้รูปแบบการเล่นหลักจะเป็นแนว Fighting แต่ Chronophantasma ก็ถือได้ว่าเป็นเกมที่น่าลองครับ

โดยรวมแล้ว "BlazBlue: Chronophantasma Extend" นับได้เป็นอีกเกมจาก Console ที่พอร์ตมาสู่ PC ได้อย่างน่าประทับใจและน่าซื้อหาไว้ในครอบครองมาก ถึงแม้ออกจะช้าไปมากก็ตามทีเถอะ

9 / 10

ข้อดี:
+ เหล่าตัวละครที่มีเอกลักษณ์โดดเด่น
+ เนื้อหาและฉากหลังของเกมที่น่าสนใจที่ถูกบอกเล่าในแบบ Visual Novel
+/- ระบบ Stylish ที่ช่วยให้ชาว Casual Gamer สามารถสนุกไปกับเกมได้
+ โหมดการเล่นต่าง ๆ ที่ถูกพัฒนาให้ดียิ่งขึ้นไปกว่า Continumm Shift อีกมากโข
+ ตัวเกมเสถียรมาก แทบจะไม่มีปัญหาใด ๆ ให้เห็น

ข้อเสีย:
- แฟนบอยของ Series นี้ไม่ใช่นิยม Online คุณอาจจะหาคู่ชกด้วยยากอยู่สักหน่อย
+/- Story ของเกมค่อนข้างจะเป็นเส้นตรงกว่าภาคก่อนหน้า (แต่ก็มีแยกย่อยแตกปลายหลายสายออกไปอยู่ไม่น้อย)

21584977.review:
Runs at full speed, my arcade stick runs perfectly fine and I need to refine my skills because I got rusty... AT LEAST THE GAME'S ON PC AT LAST! ABOUT GOD DAMN TIME!!!

EDIT: After playing for some time, yet to enter online, I have not encountered ANY problems at all until now. My only problem is facing against Tager because he is a dick... Grapple and destroy in a few seconds, that jerk... >:/ Oh, works on both my laptop with GT930 and my gaming rig with GTX960, both runs perfectly.

2ND EDIT: I tried online once, got destroyed by some Japanese guy I assume, and it's not horrendously laggy, but my internet isn't good to begin with anyway, so I can't talk much about online battles.

3RD EDIT: Alright, after finishing the whole damn story mode, I can finally talk about the game itself for I do not own this on my PS3 and I did not spoil my story or whatsoever so I had a blind play. The story is great and if you've played Calamity Trigger and Continuum Shift before, you would have noticed that the story is much more straightforward now. No more purposely dying for a new route and no need to purposely do distortion drives or something. The normal and joke routes are very obvious and are very entertaining to watch. This is the first time I can feel myself loving the characters in the Blazblue series aside from liking Ragna beating the crap out of everyone. I began respecting Kagura although he can be a jerk. I liked how Noel has evolved from a wimp into, somewhat stronger girl. I liked how Jin could finally stop being a 100% jerk like in CT and CS, though he's still a jerk... And yeah, I actually liked it when Kagura made a stand and I love how all of the villains can be top level jerks to the point where I hate all of them, which is good because that's how villains should be. -The pace is faster , the rounds are more nervous
-the gameplay is deepend, with new mechanics (and still friendly ! )

21583832.review:
드디어 발매된 스팀판 "블레이블루 크로노판타즈마 익스텐드"

맨 처음에 크로노판타즈마가 PC로 발매한다고 발표났을땐 16년1월에 발매한다길래 좋아라 했지만 막상 1월이 되자 들려온 소식이라곤 2016년 2월로 연기됬다는 소식이였고.... 아아 연기된건가 하고 2월중순쯤에 발매하겠지 하고 생각해봤으나 2월에 스팀상점에 뜬거라고는 이용가능: 3월2일......
결국은 눈이 튀어나오도록 기다려서 오늘 결국에 해봤다....

이제 슬슬 게임을 평가해야 하는데.....
PC이식이라면 매우 잘됬다.
프레임드랍같은거 아직 넷플은 안해봐서(솔직히 할 자신이 없다) 멀티플레이 상태는 어떤지 잘 모르겠지만
싱글플레이는 프레임드랍 전혀 없이 원할한 플레이가 가능했고,연출역시 블블시리즈 답게 끝내준다.
스토리도 어렵고 복잡해서 그렇지 아주 좋다. 아니 그보다도 난 이렇게 고통받는 격겜 주인공은 거의 처음이야;;; 
게임의 배경이 되는곳은 카구츠치에서 이카루가로 넘겨져서 그런지 같은 카구츠치를 배경으로 하는 캘러미티 트리거나 컨티뉴엄 시프트랑 스토리가 확 달라진것 같기도 하다.
설정상으로 이카루가가 카구츠치보다 훨씬 넓다고도 하니까 그래서 그런것인진 모르지만 스토리의 스케일도 확 커진 느낌이 난다.그 덕에 다음시리즈인 센트럴픽션이 스토리 스케일이 더 작아보일 정도....
뭐 아직 센픽은 스토리가 전부 공개된게 아니라 아직은 모른다.

메인스토리 깨는거라면 일일히 음성 들어가며  천천히 플레이하면 꽤나 길다.
하지만 다 스킵하면서 전투만 하면서 진행했다면 1시간으로도 100퍼센트는 아니더라도 엔딩보는게 가능.
뭐 블레이블루의 장점이 소설같은 컷신들이니까 그냥 넘겨가면서 플레이하면 좀 아깝다.
메인스토리 말고 외전격인 스토리들도 많고 전작에는 없었던 용어사전이라던지...게임의 배경등을 설명해주는 코너라던지.... 블블 입문자들을 위해 꽤나 다양한것들을 마련해놓은것 같기는 하나...
저것들로 블블의 세계관을 완벽히 이해하기엔... 턱없이 부족하다고 본다.
입문자들을 위한컨텐츠가 부족하다는 말이 아니라 스토리가 그정도로 너무나도 복잡하고 어려워서;;

어쨋든 게임만 놓고보면 굉장히 재밌다.

평점은.....별5개중에 4개정도?
1개를 깐 이유라면 스토리이해가 너무 힘들다는점. 근데 이건 크판만의 문제가 아니라 블블시리즈 전체의문제라는거...

(2016.03.10.수정)간혹가다가 사람들이 렉쩔어 프레임드랍쩔어 ㅉㅉ망겜이러는경우가 간혹 있어서 도대체 무슨소리지 잘만 되는데 하고 하던도중 어제 처음으로 멀티를 돌려보니 블블은 게임처음시작할때 블블특유의 화려한 문구가뜨며 게임이 시작되는데 그 순간에 프레임드랍이 있다가 게임이 시작되면 다시 없어지는거 같더니 다시 화려한 각종 필살기들 쓸때 프레임드랍이 심해지더군요.
인터넷문제가 아닌가 싶기도 하지만 같은 한국인끼리 넷플을 돌렸을때도 똑같이 저러는걸 보니 그쪽 문제는 아닌거같아 보입니다.
프레임드랍이 생길땐 버튼반응속도도 아주 괴랄하게(격겜 고수들이 버튼반응속도 0.몇초 드리다고 불평하는게 핑계로밖에 안보일정도로....) 느려져서 누른지1~2초뒤에야 캐릭터가 반응하고 움직입니다.
이문제들은 분명히 격겜에게 있어선 다른게임들보다도 특히 더 치명적인 문제이지만 그래도 망겜망겜 거릴수준은 아니랄까....싱글 스토리모드 분량은 아주 빵빵하다 못해 넘쳐나고 무엇보다도 적어도 이번 블블PC는 이보다 조금 전에 발매한 스파5꼴은 안났으니...
스파5도 유저들의 원성을 많이 샀던데 얼른 고쳐지고 회복하길....
근데 내가 왜 블블 평가글에서 스파얘길 하고있지? 크흠흠

(+컨시때부터 귀차나서 스타일리쉬 썻는데 그뒤로 이제 만년 스타일리쉬 됬슴다.... 이제 테크니컬따위 못해....크으 역시 나란놈 격겜호구....)

21583534.review:
BB:CP has an incredibly comprehensive tutorial that teaches you a lot of important fighting game knowledge so that you can enjoy the story and win a fair amount of matches online. Should you not be interested in learning high-level fighting game techniques, BB:CP has a stylish fighting style that gives you access to cool looking auto combos so you can finish fights without worry about inputs.

Past all that there is a fairly large amount of story content with a story that has been building upon itself for quite some time, it even has a Visual Novel that just released on the steam store if you fall in love with the universe.

Notable mentions:
-Unique character interactions make intros fun to watch
-Arcade mode has a bit of story attached if you like a bit more writing
-Super versions of characters are available so if you love feeling totally overpowered you have the option to play an insanely strong version of any character
-Cute/Handsome anime characters
-Great ost that didn't leave me feeling like I should substitute my own music in

All in all, it's a blast to play. A lot of super moves look, sound, and feel so nice to pull off that I find myself playing matches just to appreciate the combat, kind of like how the brutalities in MKX had me going back just to get those sweet, sweet predator headshot brutalities.  Definitely see myself putting in a lot of more time into this game over the next few days.

Edit: You can also choose JP voice-overs if that's your cup of tea!

One of my favorite fighting series. Great port, plays as well as the PS4 version with the added benefit of DLC (missing some of the palettes that you can buy on PS4 but no biggy) and the ability to switch between the vanilla Chronophantasma and the extend version (restricted to certain modes).

Thanks Arc for finally bringing this gem to PC.

21582109.review:
20170707
在surface pro4 i7 16g 的核显540（new surface pro的640其实是马甲卡）在768P下开启FXAA可以满60fps 运行，发热低。有鉴于老黄搞出了平板的2G显存的新移动卡，以后平板替代笔记本指日可待（反正我已经不打算买笔记本了，改为平板+台式机）
---------------------------------
+提醒：来自用户Yubel的提醒： 在主界面按Tab进入游戏就是2P键位操作了哦,按U确定
---------------------------------------------------------------------
+画面：
1.	默认分辨率下比上一代有所提升，狗牙几乎看不到，但是分辨率到达1600X900 界面UI文字有较明显的模糊现象，比较伤眼。
2.	战斗时游戏人物仔细看的话还是有些狗牙，不过已经比上一代改良很多了，希望下一部作品能够更多的考虑高分屏用户（1080P起步，2K怎么说也该支持了）。
3.	视频画质提升较大总算不是雾里看花了，几乎没狗牙。
+BGM：
1.	OP也很赞，推荐大家听听看。
2.	目前感觉街机模式下的BGM和界面默认BGM非常一般，没有令人热血沸腾的感觉。听久了以后就完全听不下来了，完全没疲劳感！
+键位设置：
1.	尴尬的系统功能键位，目前槽点之一，没有继承上一代用户习惯的系统功能键位设定。虽然PC键位可以修改，但是不能修改的系统功能键位正在持续给一些用户造成麻烦。日厂似乎总是想要在系统默认键位上创造反人类的新高度，但总是不如意，干脆开放所有键位的修改吧。解决方案其实很简单：只要官方将默认键位1和2的位置调换下就能解决（键位1 方向键WASD，ABCD对应HJKL，确认U，返回I ，ENTER消除/菜单唤出。希望官方能在后续补丁中开发系统功能键位的修改功能。
2.	在主界面按Tab进入游戏就是2P键位操作了哦,按U确定、I返回，游戏中Tab召唤功能菜单。
+新增内容：
1.	除开故事模式不谈，增加了大量收藏要素BGM、场景、配色等等。可惜线上模式的大厅、名牌、头像等的装修贴纸，然而分辨率太低狗牙较严重。
2.	人物动作技能都有所增加和改变，战斗时变化更加丰富也更加激烈，虽然有些不习惯，但是我的诺爱尔已经完全停不下了。
3.	新人物、新场景，个人觉得个别新场景比较一般没什么特色。
4.	本作依旧没有为手残用户提供技能快捷键，按键释放招式的体验依旧棒棒的，跟街霸系列一样优秀。吾辈的K95的G键总算有用武之地了。
+语言及语音：
1.	有简体和繁体中文，虽然简体有些没汉化好。
2.	语音推荐使用日语。语音可以随时修改，不用花钱购买真是太赞了，不愧是语音大作!
+优化：
1.	优化依旧很给力，吾辈的GTX680M 1600X900一直满60FPS不卡顿，比之街霸5迷之卡顿要给力多了。请放心购买和游玩！
+联机：
1.	这次的联机模式比较不错了，在联机大厅可是按照个人需求查找和选择对战选手，而且可以看到网络信号方便选择，虽然在刚刚连上的时候会有点卡，但是正式开场以后不会卡了了，除非你网络有问题。
2.	等级匹配中的报名（自动匹配）是需要吐槽的地方，在设定中选择与自己差不多的情况下0级能匹配到个位数中的最大值9 这是什么鬼(吾辈菜鸟完全是被从地上连到天上，回到地上继续被揍上天，而且连续三把匹配到同一个对手，吓得的我赶紧关闭了报名)希望官方能在这上面花点心思改善上，不然菜鸟们可是都会被高手们虐跑的。
3.	另外各位高手遇到可以随意切的菜鸟的时候请绅士点 好歹给菜鸟们留个还手的机会吧，否则无法还手的无力感就享受不到乐趣了。
4、联机模式需要手动开启，不用像街霸5那样强制联机否则功能缺失。且细心的官方有提供键盘键位提示，好顶赞！
---------------------------------------------------------
+总结：
1.	笔记本用户请在主界面按Tab进菜单，U确定、I返回、游戏中Tab唤出菜单，或者配全键盘！
2.	笔记本用户请在主界面按Tab进菜单，U确定、I返回、游戏中Tab唤出菜单，或者配全键盘！
3.	笔记本用户请在主界面按Tab进菜单，U确定、I返回、游戏中Tab唤出菜单，或者配全键盘！
4.	定价比卡婊要友善，PC优化除开系统功能键位糟糕以外都很不错，还是值得购买和游玩的！买买买！
+另外：
1.	不要跟我说什么“谁特么用键盘玩格斗游戏”。首先，作为PCGAME，键盘是所有人的【必有操作】管你买了什么外设，就算要用方向盘玩的极品飞车你也应该给别人一个最低操作可用可设的尊重，一个PC拿起来就能玩的尊重，否则别谈什么入门友好吸纳新手。其次，人是有不同的，这是对不同玩家习惯的尊重。
2.	无论自己使用的是 手柄、键盘还是摇杆，都不能以此嘲讽使用其它设备的用户。
3.	希望下一部作品能更好的支持高分屏，也就是说希望支持的分辨率至少要有1080p,900P的win10自动放大以后那狗牙简直无法直视。

21581761.review: Blazblue has been a personal favorite of the fighting game genre. I can say without a doubt this has been one of the best versions of the games. Learning the mechanics for each character can take some serious work, especially for the challenge mode. But its the best way to understand how to combo with each character. But the balance for each character and their abilities have been adjusted for each character to a much better degree than the previous titles. Even the story mode has a simple ark to follow rather than going through 20 individual stories like with Calamity Trigger or Continuum Shift. Not to mention trying to get 100% through the true, bad, and gag endings. But the gag scenes are all their for each character and has fit in well for the same humor to follow. The extra modes in this title no doubt will give a few newbies a rage run given the extended difficulty. But even under the fustration of learning all the Distoration Finishes and Astral Heat finishings, the characters are still strong and makes one want to dive deeper into mastering the characters fully. I will give one warning, the story will still confuse some that have not seen or played through the others since some things may not make sense. Even then, its still a great story to follow up with and the fighting is just as intense. But with all the characters having their mechnical features, Bullet is a really tough one to take up. Not just her special mechnic of heat drives and dives seems pretty weak. Not to mention she does not have the best moves to open up to in combat compared to those that are faster and have range attacks. So fair warning if using her in anything... and I know there might be someone that knows how to use her better than me, but this is just a simple perspective and oberservation given the time I have played this game. In terms of time for the game, if you want to get through everything and unlock all thats possible, following up with Abyss Mode to get the most currency out of the game... its most likely to be 40-50 hours of game time for a first time run. Especially if you want to get through the hard modes and higher levels. Pratice will make perfect.Im excited to see this not just come to Steam, but now I can take Makoto Nanaya anywhere and crush all that stand before her! Sorry, I just love that character for her personality and kick buutt power! Moving on, the music continues to hold strong for not just the characters themes: but for the background themes too. Making the matches more exciting to push ahead and show everything one has for that victory. Even having the old levels and music from the previous games to be bought with the in game currency. Even having the famous Teach me Miss Litichi sceens are back for all the history and understanding the Blazblue world, and look it up for a good laugh. Overall, this game easily earns a 8/10. Worth buying anytime and expore the insane combos and story between all the characters.

21581470.review:
虽然曾经沧海难为水，但是还是给个好评吧。
=====================================
想了想觉得还是得认真地说点。
一说BB我就会忍不住去拿GG和他比。

本是同根生的两款格斗游戏的最新作在画面上就已经是高下立判了。
我说ARC你这也太不上心了，都是自己儿子最起码给BB搞个全屏分辨率嘛。如果这种DNF式的暴力放大画面也算分辨率的话。

音乐，音效，游戏系统方面我就不说了。这几个要素毕竟不是能够横向对比的东西。不过这三点他们做的都很出色。

我们来谈谈人设。就光说说四个主角。
说实话我不喜欢，或者说我讨厌BB的主角。
当然我不会肤浅到说什么角色设计沿袭了GG这种没营养的观点。
这两个人物从他们的造型设计到台词、身世、故事背景，性格外貌，还有声优的选择......
我说错了，不是这两个，是BB里的所有可用不可用的角色——都是以让看看动画玩玩GAL，之前根本没有接触过格斗游戏的人入坑为目的设定的。
或者说BB这个游戏最初，就是以此为目的的ARC的试水作。
哦你说你不是因为杉田智和和中村悠一才关注这游戏/动画的——你以为我信吗？

你不要反驳我，那个写作“帅气”读作“弱智”的操作模式已经什么都招了。

差点跑题了。
来说说为什么我不喜欢这两个——呃，主角？
白毛要流氓流氓不过SOL，要斯文斯文不过KY，角色定义太尴尬。硬要说的话你把一般后宫GAL里的男主角拎出来然后让他超能打基本上就是他了。
他弟弟就纯粹是个变态。完全没有任何能和KY比的地方。对不起我不喜欢偏执狂外加同性恋请不要再靠近我了。

那么一个格斗游戏除了上面那些还有什么可以比的呢？
剧情的话两边都是坑，一个比一个坑，不提也罢了。

我不是来引战的，这个我要强调。
毕竟你拿枪指着我我还是不会说假话。

21581269.review:
Hace algunos años habrían llamado loco a quien dijera que juegos como Blazblue llegarían oficialmente a PC, y sin embargo aquí estamos, con la tercera entrega(con un poco de retardo pero no tanto considerando que es la versión extendida).
ASW no defrauda de nuevo y este port funciona correctamente en todos los aspectos(o todo lo que he probado hasta ahora al menos).
Respecto al juego, nada que decir: buena parrilla de personajes, buen artwork y soundtrack, buena historia, variados modos de juegos. A mí personalmente me encanta el universo de Blazblue; lo que más disfruto es la historia pero la jugabilidad también es excelente.
Y el precio también es sumamente conveniente.
Gracias ASW, y espero que también podamos tener CentralFiction y GG Xrd Revelator en un futuro!

21581202.review:
First of!
If you like Blazblue already why are you still reading? Buy the game already!
This is without a doubt the most polished BlazBlue you can get right now, and it's not even a full priced game (thank the lord)
For PC users this is finaly a chance to get into Blazblue with a huge character roster. The new characters are all realy unique and bring a totaly new playstyle to the game. The story might be a little hard to get into this late in the series, but you could always read about everything that happend before in the Library if you realy wanted to.

I'm also realy pleased that the character colours and announcer voices etc. aren't paid DLC anymore. You can now unlock these with points that you get for just playing the game.

The only realy big downside to me at the moment is that there's barely anyone online on the PC version.
So here's hoping you'll all start buying this game and come online for some epic battles :D

21580486.review:
1년의 기다림끝에 나온 블레이블루: 크로노판타즈마 익스텐드 (BBCPEX)
블블팬이라면 닥치고 구매하고 지금쯤 100시간넘게 플레이하고 있겠지만(나처럼)
블레이블루를 처음접하는 사람들을위해,혹시몰라서 평을남긴다.

장점
-각 캐릭터마다 드라이브라는 시스템이있어 캐릭터마다 개성이있음
-CP에와서 오버드라이브라는 시스템이 추가되어 역전의 기회가 많아지면서 재미도 상승
-2D 격투게임에서는 거의 최상의 그래픽
-화려한 이펙트
-용어집추가로 진입장벽을 낮춤
-판치라가 있음(...)

단점
-용어집추가로 진입장벽을 낮추었지만 전작들에비해 상승된 콤보난이도
-점점갈수록 스토리가 꼬이고, 산으로간다
-전버전들인 1.0과 1.1에 비해 조정이 밸런스와 관계없이 이상해짐
-랭킹매치에 사람이없다(...)

하지만 격투게임 초심자도 용어집을통해 격투게임용어 뿐만이 아니라 스토리와 캐릭터등등 용어들이 추가되 전작들보다 많이 흥미로워지고, 초심자들도 금새 적응할수있을것이다.

결론은 강력추천. 구매합시다 여러분.
